Name: Dawn Breaks on Dark Tides
QuestDesc: With the Dark Tide's threat to Ragunna eliminated, you prepare to set off to Septimont City...

Unlock.Name: A Stranger in a Strange Land

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella went inside to prepare that "antidote"... She should be finished now. Time to find her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the family "antidote," made to suppress Leviathan's spiritual corruption. Take it now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long as we can identify the problem, there's a way to fight back. You carry the Sentinel's power within you. That's keeping the corruption at bay for now. What's left... are the hallucinations and whispers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've learned about Leviathan's current state from Galbrena. The Fisalias have resisted the Threnodian for a century. Its whispers aren't undefeatable. We will defeat It.

Options.PlotLineKey: So this is the worst-case scenario you warned me about.
You must have suspected something for a while now.
I still find this hard to accept.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan needs a Harbinger with enough influence to spread Its "gospel." You're the Laureate of Ragunna and the Hero of Heroes in Septimont. That's more than enough to be Its first choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your path overlaps with Avidius. The Tidespawn are shaped by the Harbinger's thoughts and memories. Neither the Thundering Mephis nor the Feilian Beringal are native to Rinascita. So...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You once said the Harbinger had to be corrupted by the Dark Tide. But I still don't show any signs of corruption...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suspect... the one corrupted might not be "you."

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... the Dark Tide, huh? I ate some back at the hunting grounds. It tasted kinda funky... made me super sleepy. Ever since then, I've been having the weirdest nightmares...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby does... carry the Dark Tide's frequency...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby must have absorbed many other frequencies. So while the Dark Tide's frequency lay in wait... it was masked by the others.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It makes sense. You two share life and energy. As the primary in this bond, your frequency has been overriding Abby's... Leviathan planned for this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, did I... did I do something wrong?

Options.PlotLineKey: You've always done great, Abby.
It's not your fault, Abby.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We made a call when it mattered. I asked you to absorb the Dark Tide. We couldn't have known what it would become. You didn't do anything wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... I-I can go hungry if I have to, but you, {PlayerName}, you better not get hurt...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The real threat is Leviathan. If we want to end this for good, we kill It and destroy Its Paradise.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...From what I know, Leviathan manifests Its kingdom by flooding Rinascita with the Dark Tide. That's how it turns the real world into the Journeying Paradise.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we've already secured Ragunna and Septimont. The Fabricatorium and the hunting grounds are both stabilized... So why is this Paradise still there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything you've done has slowed down or maybe even sealed off some of Its pathways. That's why Leviathan is resorting to Its "final plan."

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This so-called divinity is more devious than humanity realizes... The Paradise you saw is not of this world. It stands... within the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Matriarch of Fisalia, you have guarded this truth for over a century. Now... we need your insight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I couldn't see the truth until the Threnodian's whispers finally quieted. Only then did those ancient records, once twisted beyond recognition, begin to make sense again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan... was born from the shadows in our hearts. From our longing to connect and belong. It took the shape of a sea creature, because nothing frightens us more than the deep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It used faith to spread a spiritual plague. All the while, it has been feeding on our pains. Fear, despair, sorrow...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our ancestors believed Leviathan survived by absorbing these emotions. Little by little, it burrowed into Rinascita's collective unconscious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They said the Dark Tide is that subconscious made real, an ocean of shared trauma. That's why... they called Leviathan the "Master of the Deep."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard them. All those voices in the Dark Tide. And before I touched the gate... I felt it. Fear. Sorrow. Like it was pouring out of the people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The stronger the conflict, the deeper the emotion it stirs. That's what shapes our memories and subconscious...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why the Playwright kept forcing Rinascita into conflict. Every tragedy, every struggle... it wasn't random. It was all to keep feeding Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The End Times are drawing near. The Ragunnesi cling to hopes of a blissful afterlife. Septimontians have long believed in "another world" that begins after death...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan may have drawn from these subconscious beliefs, "aligning" with those desires to fabricate a false future and afterlife within the Dark Tide—the illusion of the Journeying Paradise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If that's true... once the people's belief in the End Times reaches its zenith, their consciousness will align entirely with Leviathan's vision. Like Gilberto, and the others who were fully corrupted...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Its power of assimilation will grow stronger, until the line between imagination and reality vanishes. The Journeying Paradise will descend upon the world, just as before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...When it does, every soul in Rinascita will be unified under Its control. No thoughts. No will. Just blind devotion... No different from the Tidespawn.

Options.PlotLineKey: ...So how do we fight Leviathan?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You saw it in the illusion. It cast aside the Sentinel's form and took on Cartethyia's. That means... The first step in her plan is complete.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan is still watching the real world. Because of the "Mark of the Dark Tide," It can read your thoughts. So for now... we can't share the full plan with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you must have sensed it by now. Your connection with Rinascita runs deeper than I, or even you, ever imagined...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're not just the Harbinger of Despair... You've become a vessel of Rinascita's hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So go. Gather every last flicker of it. This is a "hunt," yes. But it's also more than that. It's a war of spirit. Of light against shadow. Hope against despair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To take Leviathan down, our belief has to be unshakable. If there's doubt in your heart... then stop. A new path won't reveal itself unless you're ready to walk it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For now, the Dark Tide in Ragunna is under control. And I think... I've figured out what It plans to do next...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before the bells of Paradise ring, I'll buy you time. When you're ready, head to Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like the Playwright said, when the moment comes, everything—fiction and reality, past and future—will converge there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Even after drinking the Fisalia's family "antidote," your heart remains unsettled.

Galbrena's words help reveal that it is Abby who has been corrupted by the Dark Tide. Because you share life and energy, the corruption passed to you as well. Now, the only way to reverse it is to defeat Leviathan and destroy Its Paradise.

From the Fisalia's ancient records, you learn that the Dark Tide is the "subconscious ocean of the Rinascitans' shared trauma." You also uncover Leviathan's final plan to bring Its Paradise to the world. Galbrena and Cartethyia have a plan to stop this, but because you bear the Mark of the Dark Tide, Leviathan can read your thoughts. For this reason, they cannot reveal everything to you. Yet throughout this journey, you have felt the trust others have placed in you. You are not just the "Harbinger of Despair," you are also a vessel of Rinascita's hopes. In this war of spirit, only an unshakable resolve can stand against Leviathan.

Galbrena spreads her wings and takes flight. With the Dark Tide in Ragunna contained, it's time for the next step. You prepare to head to Septimont. Everything will come to a head there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Members of Fisalia will relocate to Averardo Vault. When I meet with Carlotta and the others, I'll relay what we've learned about Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the Harbinger matter... I'll keep that confidential to prevent further panic. That's likely why the Discord Slayer has kept it quiet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what I understand of Leviathan... It chose you not because It can control you, but to hinder your progress.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But looking into your eyes, I see... no matter the obstacle, you won't stop moving forward.

Options.PlotLineKey: I have some questions I wanted to ask you.
I'm preparing to leave for Septimont.
I still have some matters to attend to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm. There are still some ancient records I have yet to fully decipher. If you're interested, I'll share what I can.

Options.PlotLineKey: About Leviathan...
About the Dark Tide...
About the Harbinger of the Dark Tide...
About Cartethyia and Galbrena...
I'm preparing to leave for Septimont.
I still have some matters to attend to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The records say that since the dawn of civilization, Leviathan, under the guise of Imperator, wormed Its way into the Rinascitans' faith and thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When discovered by the Sentinel, Leviathan hastily unleashed the first Dark Tide, attempting to harvest the civilization.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that battle, the Sentinel was assimilated by the Threnodian. But in doing so, Imperator bound Leviathan, entrusting <ano=the "lantern" filled with Their power>the First Relic</ano> to the First Primus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The calamity was quelled by Napoli the Second, but Leviathan's "poison" left deep scars on Ragunna and Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since then, every Primus has upheld the "Oath of Silence" to hide the truth—the people once worshipped the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And yet... even in chains, Leviathan used "twisted faith" to spur conflict. Suffering, turmoil, and struggle that followed all continued to feed It...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The "Dark Tide of this world" was a calamity wrought by Leviathan's hand. But the heads of our family have long suspected that Rinascitans have always harbored a "spiritual Dark Tide."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It takes root in the shadows, deep in the valleys of our fears. When the Threnodian draws forth enough anguish, It may call a Dark Tide into being. And in the terror of calamity... It feasts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The "whispers" once planted an idea in our minds: the Dark Tide is fate, and Leviathan its keeper. In hindsight... perhaps it was not so far from the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our collective subconscious flows endlessly through the Dark Tide, by day and by night. Leviathan lies hidden in its depths, weaving unseen changes, delivered to us through our dreams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When those altered bits of us rise to the surface, they slip into the waking mind. Our choices and actions were then guided by a will without form.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I fear Leviathan has reclaimed full control over the Dark Tide. Our every thought and feeling... may now fall beneath Its gaze… and bend to Its will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Galbrena and Cartethyia hesitated to reveal their full plan... and perhaps this is why. As she said, only an unshakable will can stand against Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Harbinger of the Dark Tide is chosen by Leviathan, an Anchor of Reality that summons the Tidespawn. A vessel, too, for spreading Its "gospel"… and gathering Its "sustenance."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Harbinger is condemned to wander the Dark Tide's illusions. And as the corruption seeps deeper, the boundary between dream and reality begins to unravel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In time, they may mistake the living for monsters… or even strike down those dearest to them in illusion. Tragedies born of confusion...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To others, and even to themselves, they may come to embody "malice and fear" itself. If they surrender to that fate, the Dark Tide will devour them whole... leaving behind nothing but a puppet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The records speak of Harbingers who resisted until the end. To spare others from greater harm, they each made the same choice... To take their own lives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you... No, there must be another way. We must bring an end to Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia's condition... can only be described as "death." For now, we must accept that truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Galbrena confided in me, though only in veiled strokes, her intentions. In truth, I know no more of her than you do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I only know she bears the rare ability to move between this world and the Dark Tide's illusions. It was through that gift she was able to pull you back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What I saw in her eyes... was unwavering focus. The kind of resolve found only in those who have truly stood against the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But in those depths, I also saw a blackened will... Absolute, heedless of means or cost. I wonder… what crucible of blood and fire shaped it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thankfully, those flames are not aimed at us. Her sights are clear. She simply waits for the moment to pull the trigger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To us, she is an ally worthy of trust. Should danger arise… you may trust her with your back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand Septimont calls for your aid even now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As Galbrena said, we must gather every last flicker of hope. We will stand with the Montellis and the Order to face the crisis in Ragunna. This front is ours to hold.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If your strength wanes... do not overburden yourself. Safe travels, {PlayerName}.

Chapters.Title: Ride the Wingray to Septimont City

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Keep moving! Stay in line and follow instructions. No dawdling. I promise... we will return soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, well. Is that you, Unwritten One? So you did decide to grace us after all. Thought maybe you'd forgotten about us.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's get back to business.
Still the same Iuno, I see.
Now's not the time for teasing, Iuno.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you come straight from Ragunna?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I did. Has it begun here too? I see you're starting evacuations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An unannounced High Tide. But that term doesn't even begin to cover it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No signs. No patterns. The Dark Tide's spawn are surfacing at random... even outside the City of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It doesn't make sense. The Earthrend Wedge is still holding back the Dark Tide at its depths... At any rate, Augusta's already led a team to the Sanguis Plateaus to investigate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for me, I'm helping out here. Someone has to stop the panic from turning into a stampede.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not just Septimont. Ragunna has been hit too...

Options.PlotLineKey: (Brief Iuno on Ragunna's situation...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see, Ragunna too… And Avidius... He never bent the knee, never played by the rules. Why is it that fate always strikes hardest at those who dare to defy it?

Options.PlotLineKey: People still don't remember you?
You still can't give new prophecies?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just a helpful, ordinary person now, helping the Temple with the evacuation. No more restraints from the Tetragon. No prophecies... I admit, I've never felt freer. It's just...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not just me. No Priestess can see Septimont's Auguries anymore. In our visions, it's all gone. Just blank.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The last prophecy ended with, "The Dark Tide will erupt and engulf all of Septimont." After that... nothing. And with this abnormal Dark Tide behavior, people are starting to fear the end is upon us.

Options.PlotLineKey: But maybe… that doesn't mean the end is near.
A blank future could mean a new beginning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nice thought. If only more people shared your hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But in the face of something this vast and unknown, fear is only human. We can't blame them for trembling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aquila, any word?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …The Dark Tide has been spotted at the Three Heroes' Crest.

Options.PlotLineKey: How bad is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bad. It's the highest point in the Sanguis Plateaus, well beyond the Blightcloud's reach. The Dark Tide has never touched it before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They call it the Three Heroes' Crest for the three Heroes of Heroes who once stood there. Many believe their blessing has kept it one of the few sacred places the Dark Tide cannot reach.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If even that place isn't safe... We need to see it with our own eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Septimont still needs us too...

Dialogues.Speaker: Resolute Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Worry not, Honored One. The Senate will oversee the evacuation. Please, go assist the Ephor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Resolute Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We may lack your strength, but we will not stand idle. We will do everything we can to hold the line!

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were born in Septimont. Resistance runs in our blood, and we were raised beneath the shining legacy of heroes. You think we'll sit back and let ruin claim us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Resolute Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're counting on you, Honored One!

Options.PlotLineKey: That's why I'm here.
For Rinascita!
I won't shame the title of Hero of Heroes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hate to admit it, but the current Senate's grown a backbone. Cowards wouldn't last long working under Augusta, anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, {PlayerName}. Let's find her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After parting ways with Cantarella, you set out alone for Septimont City.

By the time you arrive, the city is already preparing for war. At the gates, you encounter Priestess Iuno helping to evacuate civilians. You recount what happened in Ragunna, and she tells you that the Priestesses can no longer deliver new prophecies. Because of this, many people now believe the apocalypse is nigh.

Griffrex "Aquila" brings unprecedented news from the Plateaus: the Dark Tide has erupted near the Three Heroes' Crest. Named after three Heroes of Heroes, the peaks have been one of the few sacred places in Septimont untouched by the Dark Tide. You and Iuno decide to head to the Plateaus to meet Ephor Augusta, while the Senate stays behind to oversee the evacuation. In this time of crisis, everyone is doing everything they can to hold the line.

Now, mount the Griffrex with Iuno and fly toward the battlefield.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Traces of the Dark Tide are everywhere...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tidespawn always shows up where we least expect them and never slow down. Our warriors are stretched thin just trying to hold the lines.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even though the Common Echoes here don't depend on the Genesis Nexus, they're still breaking down due to the Dark Tide's corruption.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't wear that face. These are Septimont's warriors. They don't fall easy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There, the Three Heroes' Crest. Looks like they just finished a battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's pick up the pace. You fought beside Augusta before, and you once led the battle to defeat the Sovereign. Your presence will rally them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Weary Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look! It's {PlayerName}, the Honorable One!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My fellow warrior! You came!

Options.PlotLineKey: It's been a while, Lupa.
My fellow warrior! It's been a while.
May applause greet you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feels like just yesterday we were fighting side by side in the Colosseum. And now look at you, "Hero of Heroes" and all. Didn't see that coming!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, your arrival is appreciated.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, let me introduce you. Augusta, this is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno. We know each other.

Options.PlotLineKey: What? When?
Did... everyone's memories recover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A lot happened while you were off adventuring. You missed some fun.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Recover...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem, never mind that. Didn't I say before? Never underestimate my charm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is strange… From the moment we met, it felt like we were cut from the same cloth. Like we'd known each other before. She might seem unmoored, but when the storm hits, she holds fast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright then, Augusta. What's the situation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Theoretically, the Dark Tide flows here from the Blightcloud above the Plateaus. High Tides have always followed its movements.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this time, nothing. No Blightcloud anomalies. No frequency fluctuations near the Three Heroes' Crest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We always knew the Earthrend Wedge was a stopgap as we continued to search for a permanent solution. But this... eruption without warning defies everything we thought we understood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We repelled the first wave and set up an Anti-Corrosion Ward using Anchor Obelisks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you discovered anything?

Options.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus is incubating the Threnodian...
The Threnodian is on the verge of rebirth...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What?! But... I thought the Sovereign's death would sever the root cause of the Paradise's descent. But Leviathan's rebirth… This is a whole new thread of fate...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus, always scheming in shadow. Its wicked ambitions know no end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Messenger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your Excellency! Another outbreak! Tidespawn heading straight for the camp!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, Leviathan won't spare us any time to breathe.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's go. My sword is ready.
I wouldn't miss this fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been too long since we stood shoulder to shoulder in battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Warriors! The battle horns sound once again. Let those who defy Septimont tremble at our fury and fall before our valor!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
From high above, you and Iuno witness the Dark Tide's onslaught. Yet the warriors of Septimont stand unbroken. Their unyielding spirit stirs hope in your heart.

The Griffrex dives, bringing you swiftly to the battlefield. There, you reunite with Augusta and your old partner, Lupa. Iuno, once "forgotten," seems to have rekindled her friendship with Augusta as well.

Augusta explains the abnormal Dark Tide surge at the Three Heroes' Crest. To hold it back, they've set up Anti-Corrosion Wards using Anchor Obelisks. You share your own intelligence, but the Tidespawn strike again before more can be said. As Septimont's Hero of Heroes, you leap into the fray without hesitation. Inspired by your resolve, the warriors rally behind you. It's time to show the enemies once more the fury of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah! It's always a blast fighting beside you, my fellow warrior!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another horde inbound. They're not letting up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're heading straight for the Anchor Obelisks!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We will stop them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tidespawn, dead ahead! Let's cut 'em down in one clean sweep!

Chapters.Title: Head to the hunting grounds with your companions
Defend the Anchor Obelisk against the Tidespawn
Defeat the Tidespawn and protect the Anchor Obelisk

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, how is the situation there?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just cleaned them up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've cleared our sector too. Regrouping now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Is it just me, or have they slowed down a little?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Messenger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your Excellency! They're targeting the remaining Anchor Obelisks now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the Gladiators guarding them... They haven't recovered from the last wave…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave them to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. We'll split up and reinforce the rest. Stay sharp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Unyielding Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More Tidespawn at the southwest basepoint!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh. Trying to wear us down one flank at a time, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Resolute Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're closing in on the Obelisks on our side!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... something's off. They're striking at weak spots in the formation... Since when did they fight with strategy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan. It's directing them. It saw we were spread too thin and scattered their assault on purpose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Fighting to the Death
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: T-the north flank... Hold the Obelisks at all costs!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I release this attack... the whole Obelisk array may fall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's testing me. Seeing if I'll trade lives for victory...

Options.PlotLineKey: We can't be everywhere all at once…
It's driving us into a corner.
If only we had more fighters...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The Dark Tide's assault is relentless, targeting the weakest links of the Obelisk array. You and your companions cannot cover every front, and the situation grows dire...

Then, several familiar teleportation circles light up. The voices of your companions from Ragunna ring across the battlefield, and Galbrena arrives as well. They've come to reinforce the other fronts, helping the warriors reclaim the Anchor Obelisks.

Heroes from distant lands reunite here to face the crisis together. You take heart, and steel yourself for the battle still ahead...

Options.PlotLineKey: How are you all here?
That teleportation circle...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's deal with the mess first! Plenty of time to catch up after!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One Obelisk remains on the northeast...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll take that one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have my thanks, heroes from afar. May your names be etched in eternity!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This battle is not over yet. Let's end this, together!
—So! This is where we're needed, right? Time to help reclaim those Obelisks!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The north flank's ours! Let's give 'em a grand show!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montellis greet you. We will secure this side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The poison Leviathan leaves behind... Allow the Fisalias to cleanse it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whew, made it this time! I've got this side covered!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the name of Imperator! We'll protect the Obelisks here!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the Tidespawn and protect the Anchor Obelisk

Dialogues.Speaker: Stalwart Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never thought I'd see the day... fighting side by side with the Order of the Deep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Fighting to the Death
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Onward, comrades! We're not about to shame Septimont now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Resolute Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've heard of the Montellis' "Sentry Constructs," but seeing that kind of firepower up close is something else...

Dialogues.Speaker: Unyielding Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That "poison"… it healed me? Maybe the Fisalias aren't as monstrous as they say…

Dialogues.Speaker: Amazed Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: S-she's absorbing the Tidespawn?! What kind of power is that?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is that in the center? An opening? Something inside is sending them frequencies to recover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tidespawn are still hiding in there, ready to strike again... Damn it. There's no end to this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We won't last much longer at this rate...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The entrance is open. Now's the time...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...What are you doing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What I always planned to do—hunt the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The moment I jump into the Dark Tide, the Tidespawn will retreat to defend. That's when you seal the Anti-Corrosion Ward. Trap them in one stroke.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jump into the Dark Tide? Are you out of your mind?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More precisely, into the Journeying Paradise. This suffocating despair you see... It's a gateway. And Leviathan's sanctuary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're saying Leviathan built the Paradise inside the Dark Tide?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That grand city you glimpsed within it... It wasn't a hallucination. It was real. The Paradise's first form.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything It plotted fell apart. With no other choice, It began spreading the gospel of its "Paradise" by force… And that gives us a chance to "kill" It.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right now, It's trying to break the Earthrend Wedge's seal and drown all of Rinascita in the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that's not Its true goal. It feeds on our terror. On "despairing frequencies." That's what fuels Its rebirth and Its "Paradise."

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We must strike at the root. Kill Leviathan. Tear down the Paradise It's built. If not, it will descend upon Rinascita. Just as it did here, at the Three Heroes' Crest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Paradise won't fall unless we can reach it. How exactly do we do that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The living can only enter the Journeying Paradise once they've been corrupted by the Dark Tide. Even then... one of you must go in first to open the way for the rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Inside, there's a "spatial anomaly." Whoever goes first must use the Sentinel's power to break through it, then find a "Waystone" to create a "connection" for the others to follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta, you buried the "Waystone" yourself. But it's been corrupted. Only the Sentinel's power can purify it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take it. Leviathan's eye is still on this place, so I'll say no more. I trust you'll understand what's left unsaid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once I'm inside, I'll draw Its attention. That'll buy you enough time to prepare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good, all locked and loaded. Now if you'll excuse me… Someone's got to teach the Dark Tide some manners.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? No... Hold on now—

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you, {PlayerName}... If your resolve is true, be ready. When the time comes, I'll guide you to Paradise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See you all in "Hell."

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tidespawn are retreating to the center! They're all inside the Ward's perimeter! Augusta!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now! Activate the Anchor Obelisks!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We did it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... what good is that?! She just rattles on, doesn't even check if anyone's really listening, and then dives headfirst into the Dark Tide!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Journeying Paradise lies within the Dark Tide... I do not think she was lying. That "grand city" she spoke of... I saw it myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, we've set up camp near the Three Heroes' Crest to keep watch. Let's head back and rest for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There must be a way forward. Once we're back, we'll gather all of Ragunna's heroes and plan our next move together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The battle rages on. Just as you begin to worry it will drag on into a war of attrition, Galbrena makes for the cliff's edge, preparing to throw herself into a strange opening within the Dark Tide. It is the gateway to the Journeying Paradise, and Leviathan's sanctuary.

Galbrena explains that Leviathan's true goal is to use humanity's fear of the Dark Tide to accelerate the creation of the Journeying Paradise. Only by defeating Leviathan and destroying Its Paradise can the crisis truly end. But with Leviathan's eye on you, she only offers a cryptic hint on how to enter, trusting you to understand.

Galbrena then plunges into the Dark Tide, drawing Leviathan's attention and buying you time to plan. Seeing the Tidespawn immediately pull back to defend the opening, Augusta orders all Anchor Obelisks to be activated at once to seal the Dark Tide's spread.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The nature of the Dark Tide and Leviathan… I see where we are now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}! You're here.

Options.PlotLineKey: Now will you tell how you made it here?
How did you know we needed reinforcements?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Regarding that... I think it's best you hear it from "them" directly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At a makeshift camp near the Three Heroes' Crest, your companions are already waiting. You worry about the situation in Averardo Vault and ask why your Ragunna allies have come… Just then, a familiar voice sounds on your Terminal…

Options.PlotLineKey: ...Right. Looks like I don't need to worry about your end.
Just try not to bring down their Vault in the process.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Aalto briefs you on the situation at Averardo Vault. All available Bloom Bearers from the Black Shores have been sent to Rinascita.

He explains the nature of the Threnodian's revival and a possible countermeasure. The Threnodian you are facing is one the Fractsidus revived and recreated using the Gem. If Abby, with the ability to absorb Threnodian frequencies, can carry the Gem within itself, the Black Shores might be able to contain It using Tethys's infinite Sonoro expansion.

But Leviathan is rooted deeply in the minds and souls of Rinascita's people. Only they can truly face it. Therefore, at Ragunna's request, some powerful Resonators have been sent to reinforce you at the Three Heroes' Crest. As for Averardo Vault and the civilians of Septimont, the Black Shores will stand as the last line of defense, guarding them until your safe return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem! In any case, you just focus on driving your blade straight into Leviathan's heart. We'll be Rinascita's last line of defense, and we'll be right here waiting for your safe return!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yo! Loud and clear, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, all available Bloom Bearers have arrived in Rinascita. We're standing guard at Averardo Vault, and Buling is already en route to reinforce Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the Threnodian blindsided us in Jinzhou, we ate some dust. But this time? The Black Shores will show the world who we really are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've already synced intel with Ragunna, and time's short, so I'll make this a quickie. We've drawn some key conclusions about the Threnodian in Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian is the shadow of civilization, formless and immortal. According to Imperator's judgment, It can't be erased entirely… only shackled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the one you're about to face is different. The Fractsidus used the Threnodian's Gem to resurrect it, and that created a crack in the shell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tethys believes that with Imperator's power, you might be able to split the Gem from the Threnodian and stop Leviathan from fully reviving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you can extract the Gem, Tethys can tap into a Sonoro's infinite expansion to lock that thing down for good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One more thing. Back in Jinzhou, Abby proved capable of absorbing the Threnodian's frequencies. This means, in theory, it could act as a temporary host for the Gem.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh. But know this, the Threnodian Leviathan is rooted deeply in the minds and souls of Rinascita's people. Only they can truly face It.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At Ragunna's request, we've teleported some of our strongest Resonators to reinforce the frontlines at the Three Heroes' Crest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So leave the civilians to us. We'll keep them safe. As for combat power? I called in some... insurance. Never hurts to play it safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, we...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Into Woolies' belly you go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feed my blossoms, self-deceivers!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you don't have...

Dialogues.Speaker: Calcharo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unleash the fangs!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Aalto briefs you on the situation at Averardo Vault. All available Bloom Bearers from the Black Shores have been sent to Rinascita.

He explains the nature of the Threnodian's revival and a possible countermeasure. The Threnodian you are facing is one the Fractsidus revived and recreated using the Gem. If Abby, with the ability to absorb Threnodian frequencies, can carry the Gem within itself, the Black Shores might be able to contain It using Tethys's infinite Sonoro expansion.

But Leviathan is rooted deeply in the minds and souls of Rinascita's people. Only they can truly face it. Therefore, at Ragunna's request, some powerful Resonators have been sent to reinforce you at the Three Heroes' Crest. As for Averardo Vault and the civilians of Septimont, the Black Shores will stand as the last line of defense, guarding them until your safe return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If not for the Black Shores' aid, we would not have arrived so swiftly, or with such peace of mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This disaster has swept across all of Rinascita. We Ragunnesi won't cower behind Septimont's walls, nor will we sit idle while the Dark Tide ravages your lands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Septimont has long stood as the vanguard against the Tidespawn. This is your battleground. We'll follow your lead, Your Excellency. Just say the word.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your trust. Though Septimont and Ragunna have drifted apart over the years, in the face of such calamity, we stand together as one for Rinascita. There's no need for formality between us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan is the source of this chaos. If the Black Shores' plan can truly seal It away, then perhaps the storm It unleashed may yet be stilled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Discord Slayer spoke of a "connection" between the "Waystones." She must've meant the Anchor Stones' ability to resonate and link with another.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If there's another Anchor Stone inside the Dark Tide… that connection could open up a path for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the Dark Tide swallowed me, I did leave an Anchor Stone behind… But how did you know that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not important right now. The real issue is that the Anchor has been heavily corroded. To reactivate it, we'll need to purify it using the Sentinel's power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if we take another Anchor Stone with us, its power alone won't be enough to pierce the spatial anomaly inside the Dark Tide... and open up a path...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Reassured by the Black Shores' support, you turn your focus to Leviathan. Galbrena's parting words hinted that if Augusta's Anchor Stone in the Dark Tide can be reactivated, the resonance between Anchor Stones may reveal a path to the Journeying Paradise. But to purify the corrupted Anchor, the Sentinel's power is still needed.

A stranger from Huanglong brings the "Lantern of Napoli the Second," which contains a fragment of that very power, but only enough for one person. Each of your companions offers to take the risk, but you argue firmly and claim the task.

Still, they refuse to let you bear the burden alone. Together, you devise a final plan: you will enter first to activate the Anchor Stone and create a path. After that, the others will drink the Fisalia "antidote" and follow you into the Dark Tide. There, in the Journeying Paradise, you will reunite and face Leviathan together.

Until then, they will hold the line at the Three Heroes' Crest. The Dark Tide has yet to settle, and the moment to enter has not yet come. For now, you can rest and gather strength for the battle ahead.
You'll need this.

Options.PlotLineKey: The lantern of Napoli the Second...?
How did this end up with you?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A dying martyr entrusted it to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The First Relic, infused with Imperator's pure, original power. That light once drove back the darkness across Rinascita.
Most of its strength was spent purging the Dark Tide beneath Ragunna. What's left can only shield one person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone will need to carry it in first, to reach the Anchor Stone and reactivate it.... I'll do it. As a captain, navigating through uncharted waters is second nature.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll go.

Options.PlotLineKey: Friends, this is not up for discussion.
I'm the one best suited for this task.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know how to resist the Dark Tide's corruption.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fisalia family potion grants resistance. And I've endured Its whispers for long enough. I know Its tactics. Let me face this...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We don't even know where this Anchor Stone is. Finding it may take time, and your potion might wear off before you reach it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I still carry the Sentinel's power. I can hold out longer than anyone. I have to be the one.
This relic holds all that Primus once felt. His fury, sorrow, obsession... and resolve. I see that same resolve in you.
Take it.

Options.PlotLineKey: Trust me.
The defenses here need all of you.
...Hey, don't go making this too dramatic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Cantarella, how many of your family's potions remain?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're asking if I can brew enough to carry all of us into the Journeying Paradise... If we're ready to face Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So once that Anchor Stone is activated, the path should be clear, right? Great, then would you do us the honor, brilliant Lady of Potions, and get us there.

Options.PlotLineKey: You...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, this is Rinascita's fight. It is neither your duty to shoulder it alone, nor our desire to see you do so. We will not have you face the Threnodian alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If facing Leviathan means being corrupted by the Dark Tide, then so be it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Priestesses foresaw this, "The Dark Tide will erupt and engulf all of Septimont." If that is our fate, we must meet it head-on.

Options.PlotLineKey: I understand...
Then here's the plan.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll go first. I'll enter the Dark Tide, activate the Anchor Stones' connections, and hold the path open for the rest of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meanwhile, we'll hold the line at the Three Heroes' Crest. The Tidespawn aren't the only threat. The Fractsidus might still have their hand to play.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once the Anchors are active, we'll take the potions and follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rinascita will not falter just because a few of its leaders are gone. Its people will rise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll meet again in the Paradise and end this together... Leviathan will fall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, we all understand the burden you carry. We are grateful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll continue to monitor the Dark Tide. When the moment comes, we'll move. Until then, prepare and rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That visitor from Huanglong... He must know something about Fenrico.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If the lantern came from the Fabricatorium, then what's happened to the Dark Tide sealed beneath Ragunna's seas...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (There's still time before I go. I need to find him and learn what happened down there.)

Chapters.Title: Find the Huanglong visitor from earlier

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're here... Harbinger of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who are you? How do you know about this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Qiuyuan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The capital sent me to retrieve a fugitive... and gather intel on the Threnodian's Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I came searching for Ragunna's Blessed Maiden. Instead, I found the Primus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He was tied to the Threnodian. Knew the truth of it all. But the Dark Tide silenced him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In his final moments, he passed this lantern to me. Said it was meant for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So he's...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His ambition and his crimes were buried in blood. But he paid the price. Gave his life to drive back the Dark Tide beneath Ragunna's seas.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's how the relic reached your hands. Think no more on it. Think only of what's ahead.

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe that was his atonement...
Maybe that's the debt he owed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Death is a cheap way to pay for transgressions. He knew it wouldn't be enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Listen. Every Harbinger of the Dark Tide, Fenrico, Mya, the rest... they all met the same end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Death.

Options.PlotLineKey: I know.
I'm not afraid.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I accepted this long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've already been touched by the Dark Tide. Even the Sentinel's power cannot reverse it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why we're not arguing over who goes in first. Anyone else would just suffer longer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've been resisting the Threnodian's corruption this whole time, suppressing your Resonance Ability so Tidespawn wouldn't surface. Everything you said was just to hide the truth. Deliberately.

Options.PlotLineKey: I didn't want them to worry.
The fewer who know, the better.
Don't forget, I'm also the Harbinger of hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're prepared to walk into death alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've traveled so far just to honor a dying stranger's final wish. I'll ask for just one more for me. Please...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …The Dark Tide rejects outsiders of Rinascita. But you're different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll do what I can. I'll hold the line here. You do what must be done.

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When you're truly prepared to die, death doesn't come so easily.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never act with sacrifice as a given. Not even my own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One last thing. The Magistrate of Jinzhou asked me to send her regards.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The people you helped… They're still waiting for your return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Farewell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You speak with the stranger from Huanglong named Qiuyuan. Dispatched by the Mingting Capital, he is hunting a fugitive while gathering intel on the "Threnodian's Resonator." He had originally sought Ragunna's Blessed Maiden, but instead found Primus Fenrico, who entrusted Qiuyuan with the Lantern of Napoli the Second before giving his life to drive back the Dark Tide beneath Ragunna's sea.

Qiuyuan speaks of your identity as a "Harbinger of the Dark Tide" and warns that all Harbingers share the same fate—death. But you have long since come to terms with that.

Looking at your companions busy in their preparations, you ask Qiuyuan for one favor: to help Rinascita weather this calamity. He replies that the Dark Tide rejects all but Rinascitans, and you are a rare exception. But he promises to defend the surface in your absence.

Before parting, he tells you the Magistrate of Jinzhou sends her regards. Those whom you once aided are still waiting for your return.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I wonder what's happening with the Dark Tide. I should check in with Augusta and Iuno.

Chapters.Title: Go to the Dark Tide's point of convergence and talk to Augusta and Iuno

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno. Status report.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequency is stabilizing. If you're going in, this is your best window.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember that stretch of Chaos we once crossed?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Leviathan has shaped this world through the Dark Tide… expect something similar. Shifting sands, obscuring fog. Every step, a gamble into the unknown.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Discord Slayer, Galbrena, was it? She's bound to the Dark Tide. If she dared to hunt the Threnodian, she must know how to navigate its depths.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once inside, find her existence in the Chaos. Reunite with her. She'll guide you forward.

Options.PlotLineKey: So this time, I need to Anchor to her.
What exactly does that mean? What do I do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You catch on quickly. I believe you know what to do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't tell me you forgot already? It's about the Anchoring! You've done it before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Immerse yourself in her rhythm. Feel it. Understand it. Find a trace of her within the chaotic frequencies. And when you find her... don't let her go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}... Keep your wits about you once you're inside the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry! I'll stick with {Male=him;Female=her} every step of the way!

Options.PlotLineKey: Then I'm counting on you, Abby.
You should rest while you can, Abby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just remember, you're not going in alone, {PlayerName}. When the time comes, we will be right behind you.

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. I've faced worse.
I believe in all of you, as you believe in me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're ready. Step forward.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm more than ready.
I need more time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May the eternal sun light your path. And may each step bring you closer to victory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The Dark Tide has stabilized. Now is the time to strike.

Before you depart, Iuno advises anchoring to Galbrena once inside. If she dares to hunt the Threnodian, then surely she knows how to navigate the Dark Tide.

With preparations complete, you and Abby leap into the Dark Tide together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're ready. Step forward.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm more than ready.
I need more time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May the eternal sun light your path. And may each step bring you closer to victory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa, I didn't think there's actually a whole other world inside the Dark Tide. It kinda feels... holy somehow...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Sniffs) Feels a bit like Chaos, but colder... and creepier. Like something's whispering to me... Eek!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, let's focus! Like Iuno said, if we do what we did back in the Chaos, we can Anchor to Galbrena and find her, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now let me remember... Something about "Anchoring to the memories, feelings, and connections in the Chaos." But the problem is...

Options.PlotLineKey: She's a mystery.
We barely know anything about her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah! Galbrena's always like, whoosh! She's there. And then whoosh! She's gone! Doesn't really say much either...
In life, chaos. In death, silence. A stillness veils the teeming multitudes. Glory... is washed clean in suffering's tide.
The hesitant shall not return. The timid shall not pass. Tell me, little lamb, whence do you come? And where does your path lead?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, it's that creepy guy again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Little lamb, your hostility pains me. I came to aid you. You wish to Anchor to her? A simple task.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Surely you've heard, the Dark Tide preserves memory. Her past is scattered through its depths, tangled in the currents like fractured glass.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we'll just go find them ourselves!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehehehe... The Dark Tide mirrors the chaos of the human mind—shifting, twisting. A fleeting thought, and the path ahead may vanish beneath your feet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan lurks in the depths of this world, building Its kingdom, bending this place into Its image.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place is molded by the Journeying Paradise's frequency. A vision of perfection, unmarred by flaw.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But behold, the Dark Tide's true face. A world of hatred, fear, and despair. The world your kind calls... Hell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan merged Paradise and Hell with Its power of assimilation, cloaking rot in radiance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet the mask is flawed. The Paradise is incomplete. These twin worlds bleed into one another to create spatial anomalies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Countless souls caught between light and shadow, adrift without rudder or self... Lured by false hope, they stumble into Its waiting arms.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not yet. Save its light.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will guide you. Walk with me through this wasteland. If you wish to "see" her, then walk her path. Endure what she endured.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You will hear despair's screams. See the dead beg for death. Watch souls willingly burn in cleansing fire… What is it, are you afraid?

Options.PlotLineKey: Did Galbrena send you?
Are you trying to deceive me?
Ha. I fear nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "We" share an enemy. "We" need you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Deceive you? No. "I" thirst for true, brutal battle. If I wished you dead, I would not skulk in shadow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good... I've seen many enter this realm, valiant, burning with purpose, just like you. But in the end... Heheheh. I hope you endure longer than most.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her plan is bold. But an unwonted frequency has mingled into the Dark Tide. I know not who it is. This path will prove less smooth than she hoped.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But for now, you have no choice, do you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come, little lamb. Open your eyes, sharpen your claws. It's time we journey into the underworld.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You land in another world. It's not the chaos you expected, but something almost holy. Yet beneath its solemn surface lies a sinister, unsettling frequency.

Your first goal is to reunite with Galbrena, but you barely know anything about her and have no memories to Anchor to.

At that moment, Galbrena's companion, a Tacet Discord called Chimera, appears. He reveals the truth of this Dark Tide world and offers to help you Anchor to Galbrena and guide you through this land.

Follow him. The journey into the underworld begins now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The flow of time here is slower than in your world. We have plenty of it. Be patient, little lamb. I shall keep watch over the outside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking with you through the Mark of the Dark Tide saves me considerable energy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for that small pest, put it to rest lest its corruption worsen... My presence alone is enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby, you can get some rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But, but... Alright, fine. If you say so, {PlayerName}. But if anything happens, call me right away! I'll face it with you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the "borderlands of Hell" where the boundaries between worlds tear and rend with the most savage delight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seconds ago, we basked in the light of Paradise. Now, we're plunged into the pit of endless damnation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In this infinite cycle of hope and despair, you must learn to struggle. That, little lamb, is your first lesson.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that... Galbrena, up ahead?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, a memory. The moment she first fell into the Dark Tide. She was just a little girl...

Chapters.Title: Perceive the Memory Shard left within the Dark Tide

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …I won.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cheering Youth
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you see that? That Resonance Ability? Can a child really wield that kind of power?

Dialogues.Speaker: Impressed Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She'll be a force to be reckoned with. Perhaps even rise to challenge for Ephor one day!

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Damn it... I was so close. If it hadn't been for the difference in our Resonance Ability, I could've—

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What did you do to get that kind of power?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My power? It's always been there. Since the day I was born.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Born with it... Hah! How unfair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I can't take it! I trained harder. Endured more. Bled more!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know... You're all stronger than me, and all worthy opponents. But please, you should tend to your injuries now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you... mocking us? People like you, born lucky, never understand what it means to struggle! To fight for your strength!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I really meant what I said...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (They are stronger than me... in body and in spirit. So many here are... They just don't have the same Resonance Ability...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (...Why? Why was I the only one gifted with this power?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For those who cannot stomach defeat, even sincerity tastes of cruelty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fate is never fair. It bestows gifts without reason. Whether blessing or mockery, mankind must learn to carry it with grace.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So she is from Septimont. Why did she leave? And why has she stayed away until now?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her Resonance Ability was bright and radiant back then. Now, it feels... different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The curse of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Had she returned untempered, with curse still unclaimed as gift, Rinascita would have burned for her folly. A fitting fate, don't you agree?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You claim to stand against Leviathan, yet you speak so coldly of human lives. Whose side are you really on?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The two are not in conflict. Many a mighty alliance has thrived on loathing alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I? I am a Tacet Discord. A devourer and killer by nature. My allegiance lies only with myself.

Options.PlotLineKey: But you live inside her.
But sometimes you listen to her.
But sometimes you fight alongside her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We each take what we need. She, too, accepted my "gift." Left to her own strength, she would have fallen long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do not be so eager for answers. Go live them. Feel them instead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Within Galbrena's fragmented memories, you see her as a child dazzling the arena with her radiant Forte. That bright-eyed girl is almost unrecognizable from the woman she has become...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She carved a path through this underworld for you. But the true danger does not lie in shadow. It hides in the light...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan toils endlessly to bring Its Paradise into being.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So "perfect." So faultless... so dreadfully dull. A corpse in glass.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A paradise so pristine, it begs to be defiled. Let it be painted in blood and fury.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, I was right about you. Beneath that calm shell beats a heart that burns for battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Congratulations, little lamb. You've survived the trials of the borderlands.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are these... Galbrena's traces?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go now. Claim the rewards of the brave.

Chapters.Title: Perceive the Memory Shard left within the Dark Tide

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps you have heard of the great Dark Tide that swept through Septimont sixteen years ago. It swallowed her whole...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once touched by the Dark Tide, a human's Resonance Ability and frequency are devoured... piece by piece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was just in Oak Hollow... Where am I?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I can't use my Resonance Ability. Why...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because the Dark Tide loved you, but you rejected its gift. Now, it will consume you instead. You, your power, and everything that was once yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arkyria...? Is that really you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You could have risen above us all. With your gift, you might have become the Hero of Heroes. Why did you stop? Why did you reject it? Don't you crave that glory?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Honestly, I never understood why I was born with this power. You and so many others... You deserved it more than I ever did.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've asked myself again and again... What does it mean to be strong?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You once told me real strength comes from the heart, not from outside. And someone else said... She said real strength is meant to protect.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide twisted me into a monster. People ran from me. So no, I won't accept this "gift."

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh... Well said. My frequency is nearly gone... Looks like I'll never get the chance to surpass you now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So take what remains of my strength... Live on... Live for me... Live for all of us...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why give this to me...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're not completely lost yet. You still have a chance to escape... More than any of us. And this... this is our wish...

Dialogues.Speaker: The Dark Tide's "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Within the Dark Tide lies fate itself... No one can escape the net it casts...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I always knew... You, quiet as you seem... If someone struck you down, you'd rise up and strike back twice as hard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't want to admit it before. But in the arena... You didn't beat me with power. You beat me with will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The fire in your eyes... it doesn't lie. That's why I believe you'll see it through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arkyria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So live... With pride, head held high. Free and unbound. Live for us... and prove to fate that it can be defied...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Curious creatures, humans. Always resisting fate. Entrusting all their hopes to a single soul, just to prove they will not bow to destiny.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet her power was corrupted. Back then, she was weak, as powerless as a little lamb to be slaughtered. Each step forward was a gamble with death.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But she still escaped. How?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She was born through death.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come. Let us walk on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In another memory, you watch young Galbrena fall into the Dark Tide. Her Resonance Ability was corrupted, and from that day on, she could no longer wield it...

Chapters.Title: Use the lantern from Napoli the Second to separate and alter the  Dark Tide's "world"

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The traces end here. There's no path forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan hides Its message in another dimension.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel's power you bear. Its hour has come, little lamb.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Use it to sever the worlds. Reshape what is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. If resistance comes, let that power be your blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A journey into the Abyss allows no return. It is a path ordained.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To rise, one must first learn to fall. So it was for her.

Chapters.Title: Use the lantern to switch between worlds and avoid obstacles
Use the lantern to switch between worlds
Perceive the Memory Shard left within the Dark Tide

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, I remember. When her Resonance Ability was corrupted by the Dark Tide, she fought with nothing but instinct and flesh.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She clawed through monstrosities until she stood before me. Her frequency was nearly consumed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How rare... a mortal, here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It shall gnaw upon thee. Slow, ceaseless, until thou bend the knee. Thy fate... is to be made one with it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know... the Dark Tide devours everything. Assimilates everything. If I can't escape it... then I'll use it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To claim a divinity's power is to invite divine wrath. Know this, more Tidespawn lie in wait before thee...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's already flowing inside of me... So why can't I turn it against them? Why can't I... be the one who devours them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These "false frequencies" need me to "survive." If this power... doesn't want to listen to me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I'll show it who's the real boss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thy own kind wished for thy survival... yet thou wouldst risk it all?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I can truly live.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To seek a "life true" while death surrounds thee? Absurd.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I'll show you... by living. No matter the pain, humanity can live through it... With pride, heads held high.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fate... It may be loud, but I don't think it's that strong. I... don't believe in it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To wield the Dark Tide against its spawns... fascinating. Perhaps...

Dialogues.Speaker: The Dark Tide's "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Within the Dark Tide lies fate itself... None can escape the net it casts!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It hurts... but I already see the light...

Dialogues.Speaker: Voices of the Departed
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carry our strength... and our final hopes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Voices of the Departed
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Live. With pride, head held high. Free and unbound...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I'm almost there. I won't give up...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmmm... Human flesh remaineth ever feeble. This broken vessel's frequency is sundered and shattered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet this... this is indeed a chance of an eon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I shall give one final push.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... You helped her escape the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahahaha. You are free to see it that way. But I made no vow that my "boon" came without a price.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, I never did grasp what she meant by "truly living."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you can't tame the power you carry, you'll only be dragged along by it. That's not living. And it's not the future those who helped her wished for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She carried the same will they did. Even if she failed in that wish... she'd pass that flame on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph. Beyond my understanding. But mark this, without my boon, she'd never have come this far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her defiance has drawn divine attention. Though she escaped, the Tidespawn still hunt her. <ano=To be devoured and merged>Her fate</ano> will catch her eventually.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To spare Rinascita further calamity, she fled to distant lands. Corrupted by the Dark Tide and losing all her power... At first, she could do naught but run.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But she was clever. Learned to track the movements of Tacet Discords through the Dark Tide's fluctuations. Even when barely holding herself together, she roamed the wilds, warning others of the doom to come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But men seldom listen to a girl who bears a cursed flame.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: 'Twas easier to believe she brought disaster. Some even said her flames were from Galbrena, the legendary Tacet Discord.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... Galbrena was originally a Tacet Discord's name?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A fiend of ever-burning flame. A monster who spread fear and hatred across the land, luring humans into the fire for her own cruel delight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She borrowed that name and saved many in its guise. But her one mistake... was her weakness. And that name became a fate she could no longer escape from.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide saw no more after she escaped. So...I will tell you the rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
