In yet another memory, you witness Galbrena turn the Dark Tide's power against itself to devour Tidespawn. In the end, Chimera appeared and helped her escape.

But even after escaping, Galbrena was relentlessly hunted by the Tidespawn. Fearing she might endanger Rinascita, she chose exile, fleeing her homeland for distant lands. Over time, she learned to track Tacet Discords through the Dark Tide's fluctuations, roaming the wilds to warn others of impending disasters. It was during this exile that she encountered a Flame Demon Tacet Discord named "Galbrena."

What came after, the Dark Tide cannot reveal. Chimera will tell the rest...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To consume that Flame Demon, she surrendered more of her frequency to me. Thus our pact was sealed. All that I consume, she inherits as strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, she became what she is by endlessly feeding on Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehehe, a pact always has a price. Should she fail to feed me fresh frequencies, I shall feast on her <ano=frequency>soul</ano>, piece by piece, till naught remains. So she hunts. Without end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Weak Tacet Discords are but tasty morsels. Only the strong may stand beside me. If she would grow, she must hunt true danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To crave unorthodox power, yet cling to her humanity... 'Tis a savage clash of wills between her soul and theirs. And should her will falter...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll devour her frequency. Be reborn through her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I "helped" her once broken vessel with my own frequency. Enough to survive the Dark Tide. This is a long-overdue… repayment.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. It was the souls of those humans who saved her. You just saw an opening in her broken frequency and slipped in.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Admit it. You just wanted to escape the Dark Tide, didn't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do not deny it. After centuries, a door opened at last. And she bore a soul unshaken, even at the border of life and death. The most perfect vessel I have ever known.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, suffering is a gift. Through it, she learned the true meaning of strength.

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't glorify suffering.
To endure and overcome suffering is what's worthy of praise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Fate" showed her countless tragedies, stirring her compassion but robbing her of the power to save.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "They" gave her a second life, but what I offered was a path to wrest her strength back from "Fate." And that is what she chose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She walks this path with zeal. Never resting, as if every misery in the world were born of her own weakness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and there are four more like me in her now. Ah... I almost forgot, of course, one must not forget the Flame Demon herself, Galbrena.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At this point, Galbrena feels like her true name. But what was her real name?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That, you must ask her yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
From Chimera's account, you realize it wasn't him who saved Galbrena. It was the human souls that gave her the strength to escape. Chimera only seized the opportunity to inhabit her body, trying to devour her frequency and be reborn through her in a desperate bid to escape the Dark Tide.

But in the end, she chose to surrender more of her frequency, sealing a pact with Chimera in exchange for greater devouring power. By feeding on Tacet Discords, she gradually became what she is today... Someone strong enough to stop greater calamities.

The name "Galbrena," once belonging to a Flame Demon Tacet Disord, was never hers. As for her true name, Chimera suggests you ask her yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Heh.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You came.

Options.PlotLineKey: Yup.
Chimera showed me the way.
Not a bad shot, am I?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hope I'm not too late?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not too late, not too early. Right on time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One side each?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The mists lift, revealing Galbrena locked in battle with the Tidespawn at the path's end. Her guns are knocked away, but she holds her ground with nothing but skill and grit.

You pick up her guns, fire a shot that turns the tide, and rush to her side. As promised, you meet again in "hell." With your backs to each other, you face the encroaching swarm. No words are needed. Together, you fight, each guarding one side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Guardian of the Dark Tide, a Mortarch... We meet again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tried to clear the path for you, but that thing got in my way.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You handled all the monsters along the way by yourself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More or less. Too many roads led here, and I couldn't be sure which one you'd take.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I wanted to make it easier, whichever way you chose.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've already helped more than enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So have you. There were things I couldn't have done alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the rest... Let's deal with what's in front of us first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One last thing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Incomplete Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You didn't have to go so far, Discord Slayer. Take what's left of me... This flicker of a soul won't last much longer anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Just hang in there. I'll find a way to save your frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't have to carry it all yourself. Sometimes... it's okay to lean on someone else.

Dialogues.Speaker: Incomplete Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Human frequencies dull the pain of absorption. Why not let them serve a purpose? Burn them before they turn?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I did it because I wanted to. Not everything needs a reason.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's what separates us from the Tacet Discords.
Dignity for the dead. Hope for the living.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pah... I gave you power, not so you would squander it on sentiment. Unleash your true nature. Terror... slaughter... that is what you are made for!

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your time's up. Crawl back to where you belong.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like... you've got him on a leash?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Taming him isn't the hard part, becoming stronger than him is. Oh, and keeping him hungry enough to feed on my terms.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do not mistake this for triumph, Galbrena. This battle... will not end until one of us is dead.

Options.PlotLineKey: He's kind of like Abby.
He's quite... moody.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? I think Abby is a lot cuter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let him howl. Humans don't kneel to beasts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That power you used... Was it the Sentinel's power of separation? And that <ano=Abby>incredible little one</ano>... No wonder Cartethyia had the nerve to propose such a mad plan.

Options.PlotLineKey: Mind sharing that plan now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even here, the Paradise's frequency isn't stable, which means Leviathan hasn't completely seized control. So, looks like part one of the plan worked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You bear the Dark Tide's power, but you are no Harbinger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good, we can avoid the lengthy explanation. If you're looking for the Harbinger too, you must've seen it. The apocalypse Leviathan will bring forth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was meant to remain restrained by the Sentinel. But I feel It stirring again. I followed Its frequency... and found you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most of Leviathan's power resides in me. But a fragment escaped. I've been tracking the one who carries <ano=Threnodian's Gem>that power</ano>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Gem was cast into the Dark Tide. If this is where things are at, that leads to only one conclusion...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia & Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan is about to resurrect.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Freed from the Sentinel's hold, It's returned to Its primal state in the Dark Tide, like water returning to the sea. We must trap Its frequency before we can destroy It.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or... we can use "me."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan's instinct will draw It to reclaim what was once part of Itself. The godhood inside me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that godhood has fused with your humanity. Their frequencies are nearly identical now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's exactly how we trap It. When Leviathan awakens, It won't distinguish. It will devour all frequencies blindly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I offer my humanity, I'll become an Anchor. Give form to formlessness, and trap Its frequency in one place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And if It's now hiding in the Dark Tide... I know you have a way of sending my humanity into it, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...And I suppose you know the cost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do. But I have faith in those who strive to protect this land, in <ano=Rover>{Male=him;Female=her}</ano>... and in you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide can't read either one of our minds. Only we can do this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Discord Slayer, let me be your first bullet. Fire me into Leviathan's heart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...When the time comes, I'll "kill" you in front of them. To convince Leviathan of your "necessary death."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I shall leave the rest to you. Thank you for choosing to be misunderstood, hated, and for putting your life at risk. Thank you for your resolve, Discord Slayer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Sentinel's Sword of Divinity, we split her godhood from her "humanity," leaving the divine within her. Then I fired a Dark Tide bullet to consume her frequency and send her "humanity" into the Dark Tide.

Options.PlotLineKey: An insane plan.
I really panicked back there...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan can't truly distinguish the signals It receives. It's blinded by what people believe. By tricking the one closest to the Blessed Maiden into accepting her death, we lowered Its guard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that Cartethyia has trapped Its frequency, all that's left is to gather strength, reach the Paradise, and finish Leviathan.

Options.PlotLineKey: How confident are you in hunting the Threnodian?
Don't tell me you were planning to kill the Threnodian alone...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, even I'm not arrogant enough to think I can take the Threnodian by myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No apocalypse is ever stopped by a lone hero. It's always a difficult struggle, fought by countless lives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In this hunt, my part is to clear the way while the others prepare, set the aim, and fire the first shot.

Options.PlotLineKey: You believe everyone will follow us into the Dark Tide?
But what if...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe I'm gambling. People freeze up facing the end. Fear takes hold. Even those brave enough don't always get that <ano=Resonance Ability>blessing of fate</ano>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if there's even the slightest chance to stop a disaster, I'll take it. Even if I stand alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All I need to know is that when I drain the last drop from my glass, I had the guts to pull the trigger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Worst case? I stay trapped in the Dark Tide, holding Leviathan back a little longer. That's a price I'll pay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... I think I bet on the right people.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some of us might use the word "trust."

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can sense Augusta's Anchor Stone. It lies beyond this well in the deeper realm of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the deeper we go, the stronger Leviathan's mental interference will be. Here, wear this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This "casette tape" is a rare find from Lahai-Roi. It preserves your most innate frequency. Perfect for what's ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know how it works, but it's a good time for music, wouldn't you say?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Does the song have a name?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're usually named after the one who recorded them.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, your real name is...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll tell you when this is all over. Call it a promise. A promise that we both make it back in one piece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're ready, let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After the fight, you and Galbrena release the human souls trapped within the frequencies of the Tacet Discords.

At last, she reveals the plan she and Cartethyia devised. Leviathan, revived through the Gem, has merged back into the Dark Tide, like water returning to the sea. To defeat It, Its form must first be Anchored. Cartethyia proposed using the godhood within her—its frequency now nearly indistinguishable from her humanity—as bait. If Leviathan could be lured into consuming her humanity, it would be Anchored in the process.

To accomplish this, they first used the Sword of Divinity to separate Cartethyia's godhood and humanity. Then Galbrena's Dark Tide bullet devoured the frequency of her humanity, sending it into the Dark Tide. But since Leviathan cannot discern truth, only belief, the one closest to Cartethyia had to truly believe she was dead. Only then would Leviathan lower Its guard, letting the deception succeed.

You see the unshakable resolve in Galbrena's eyes. In return, you offer her your trust once again.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Does the song have a name?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're usually named after the one who recorded them.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, your real name is...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll tell you when this is all over. Call it a promise. A promise that we both make it back in one piece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're ready, let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know how to use the Sentinel's original power, don't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then change the world if something gets in your way.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why are there so many enemies here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan's kindred. It created them Itself. Nothing more than empty husks.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What should we do? Should we avoid them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, we slay them all.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Knew you'd say that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They need no mercy. Their rest awaits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another Mortarch thrown at us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bring it on. This song is about to hit the chorus.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some faint melodies disrupted the rhythm… Try "switching worlds."

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Finally, we've arrived. The true gateway to Hell.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're here again...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Styx Lake. A myth once whispered in Septimont, now carved into reality by Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those touched by the Tidespawn often begin to see things. Hallucinations... and this lake is usually the first they find.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anger, sorrow, pain... Leviathan reads the depths of our hearts. And from them, It births this river of memory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What you see here is a part of you. The river mirrors what you fear most.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I saw those terrible visions. But why were you there too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My mind can walk between reality and the Dark Tide. I've crossed this lake many times, trying to guide the lost home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oftentimes it isn't Hell that people fear. They fear fear itself, and that creates Hell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Devotees
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Shining with your love... We stand united in devotion..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Devotees
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "With hearts full of joyous loyalty... we rise from the sea... guided by your light..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The dead grow tongues and sing praise day and night. That's what becomes of those consumed by the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Journeying Paradise reaches our world, everyone in Rinascita... will suffer the same fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh… Look at them. Lining up to flatter their Divinity, groveling for Its grace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without Leviathan's "wisdom," feeble minds like theirs are fit only to be devoured.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ceaseless worship, stripped of meaning or soul. From this shore to the next, from Paradise back to our world...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All to gather more "believers," to be drawn into the Paradise's maw. Then they'll go claim their due from Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even with the tape's help, we can't stay exposed to these "hymns" for too long... Chimera.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't take your orders.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Silence, wretched souls! There is no place for you in Paradise. Burn in your ruin and rot in Hell.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems Chimera still commands some authority here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, coming back here feels like coming home. By blood, they ought to call me... Forefather.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan was right about one thing. Fear is the most ancient and enduring truth in all living things.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fighting through more enemies, you and Galbrena finally reach the "gates of hell."

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There, do you see it? At the edge of this underworld... That's the Journeying Paradise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Inscribed Words
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Through me, walk the Path of Glorious Ascension... Through me, enter the City of Eternal Bliss...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter how Leviathan dresses it up, it can't hide the truth. It is a liar, twisting souls and selling a Paradise of lies.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This lake... It's not quite like how I remembered it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Styx Lake. A place where all souls meet. Some call it by another name—Manes Deep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan reshaped it through the Dark Tide, turning it into a furnace where <ano=frequencies>souls</ano> are melted down and reforged.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A crude imitation of the Sentinel's way of giving form to Remnant Creatures. But Leviathan takes the souls devoured by the Dark Tide and forges them into Its obedient kindreds.

Options.PlotLineKey: You seem... nostalgic.
Are you angry for those lost souls?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nostalgic? No. What I carry is rage. A rage... for vengeance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps... What I carry is rage. A rage... for vengeance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is where Chimera was born.

Options.PlotLineKey: What is Chimera, really?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... Do you mean "me"? Or... "us"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Born from the fury that courses through the earth, rage cast my spine, and slaughter forged my chest...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've torn through countless souls, rained fire on fields, slept to the wails of a thousand dying cries... They remember me as "Nemean," the name of the land I reduced to ruins. A name forever seared into their hearts with terror.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Leviathan... Its treachery dragged me into the Dark Tide. It twisted my frequency and forced me into an abominable union with the frail Goat and pathetic Serpent. We were merged into one...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since then, our frequencies gnaw and rend at one another. Torment without end! The agony wrought by Its will, I shall repay tenfold, carving bone, feasting on marrow, until nothing remains!

Options.PlotLineKey: Sounds like you were powerful.
Sounds like you were a villain.
That's a lot of big words. Speak plainly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chimera was Leviathan's first Tidespawn, created by fusing the frequencies of three powerful Tacet Discords. The first of Its kindred.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't expect nobility from him. He has the gift of wisdom, but at his core, he's still a Tacet Discord driven by instinct. A destroyer "in life," a prisoner of vengeance "in death."

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That vengeance is what broke Leviathan's leash. For now, our goals align… and that's likely why he's willing to listen this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These human frequencies... They're trapped in the Dark Tide's corruption, still clinging to their last shreds of will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan can do nothing but trap them here and torture them with the pain It's harvested. That alone is reason enough to slay It.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We end Leviathan, we set them free.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. Look, the Anchor Stone Augusta placed is just across the lake.

Options.PlotLineKey: Can we just swim across?
Can we fly across?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. The waters are dark with corruption. Trying to cross would only rouse the Dark Tide.
Wretched souls... Abandon all yearning for the light of Paradise. I come not to save, but to ferry thee to the far shore, into the underworld of hell, into frost and flame.
As for you... The living have no place upon this river. Turn back. Seek another crossing. Leave this place, and be not consorts of the dead.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you see anyone else around us?
Can you sense anything strange from him?
Is he one of Leviathan's creations?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beholder finds no anomaly. Long staff, eyes like burning coals...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Leviathan based this underworld on the old tales of Septimont, then this must be Kharon, the ferryman of the dead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Its made-up characters only mechanically follow their scripted roles. Hand me that lantern-shaped Terminal. I'll handle this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whence comes your pride, that you would defy my word?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We come by the Highest Will's command. By divine pardon, we shall cross to honor the dead and to return hope to the living.

Options.PlotLineKey: ...Please ferry us.
...Do you think it'll actually work?
...You're really getting into this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A vessel for the dead bears not the weight of the living. If you would cross, cast off the riches and honors of your former days.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The old stories say Kharon favors gold and jewels. If the living seek passage, they must offer a fortune deemed worthy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The accursed shore awaits all who fear not Divinity. If your heart harbors unfinished desires, and you fear not death... then come. Step aboard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Galbrena arrive at Styx Lake. To activate the Anchor Stone on the far shore, you must cross. But doing so would alert the Dark Tide.

From the darkness, a lone ferryman approaches. If this realm truly mirrors the underworld from Septimont legends, then this must be Kharon, ferryman of the dead.

He exists solely to perform his duty within the Dark Tide. Strange as it is, you have no better option. You ask him to ferry you across the lake.

The crossing is surprisingly smooth. Too smooth. A sense of unease stirs, but for now, your priority is to activate the Anchor Stone so your companions may follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have arrived.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Galbrena arrive at Styx Lake. To activate the Anchor Stone on the far shore, you must cross. But doing so would alert the Dark Tide.

From the darkness, a lone ferryman approaches. If this realm truly mirrors the underworld from Septimont legends, then this must be Kharon, ferryman of the dead.

He exists solely to perform his duty within the Dark Tide. Strange as it is, you have no better option. You ask him to ferry you across the lake.

The crossing is surprisingly smooth. Too smooth. A sense of unease stirs, but for now, your priority is to activate the Anchor Stone so your companions may follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was... surprisingly smooth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm. I had the Beholder on him the whole time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My instincts keep telling me something's off. We'd better stay sharp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Anchor Stone is just ahead. Let's go activate it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Its energy has been reshaped by the Dark Tide. We'll need the Sentinel's power to purify it before activation.

Chapters.Title: Head to the path leading to the Journeying Paradise

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's done. The Terminal's comms should be restored. Let's contact Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, we saw it. The Anchor Stone has been activated. Sooner than expected...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My family's potions are ready, but please, a word...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been crafted from the <ano=frequency>Threnodian's venom</ano>. Outside the corruption's reach, it induces hallucinations—warping your senses and clouding judgment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you aren't immediately entering the Dark Tide, I advise you all not to drink it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ground defenses are holding and no major fluctuations in the Dark Tide for now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... An intense frequency suddenly... It's moving toward the western front!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Is this the best the mighty Gladiators of Septimont can offer?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A grand finale deserves grandeur! How can such a dull act satisfy the audience?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha! Yes! Now this is a scene fit for the final act!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Blades do not discriminate. Leave. This one's mine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? Has Huanglong fallen so low, they now send a blind man to die?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Prisoner Scar of Jinzhou. Surrender now. One strike is all it would take to end you. Surrender, and you may be spared pain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In an epic play such as this, I refuse an early exit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My orders were to bring you back. Dead or alive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never planned on bringing you back alive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your head belongs to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Galbrena activate the Anchor Stone within the Dark Tide, sending a signal to your companions in the real world.

With the defenses at the Three Heroes' Crest holding steady, Augusta and the others prepare to drink the "antidote" and follow after you. But just then, Iuno senses a powerful frequency moving toward the western front. Scar appears, shattering the Gladiators' defenses in an instant.

Just as all seems lost, Scar's assault is intercepted by Qiuyuan's blade. The very man Qiuyuan was hunting turns out to be none other than this Fractsidus Overseer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're too late, defender of Huanglong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beneath the Dark Tide, It stirs once more...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ALL HOPE WILL BE SWEPT AWAY!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You talk too much.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The connection was cut off...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus really sent two Overseers at once...

Options.PlotLineKey: They definitely had a plan.
Did they know about our plan?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Phrolova and Scar... Their appearance was too well-timed, like they knew our strategy all along. Meanwhile, Cristoforo's just biding his time in the shadows. This must be just the beginning.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (No matter. The Dark Tide was just unleashed because of the Fractsidus's interference. And everyone there... they didn't even take the potion before it swallowed them...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trust them. Their will is stronger than the corruption.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Anchor Stone has been activated. It will guide them through the Dark Tide...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fret not. Soon, you and your companions shall reunite... in the boundless embrace of eternal night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your journey ends here. What is writ by fate shall not be swayed. To resist is to invite naught but deeper woe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh. The Fractsidus must think highly of us. Even you are here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No wonder the Beholder couldn't read your frequency. It can't pierce something as ancient as the concept of death.

Options.PlotLineKey: Who is he, really?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've seen many who can use their Forte to mimic or create, but to perfectly replicate another's frequency and even forge an entirely new body...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's only one person who can do that—the thousand-faced survivor, the Grand Architect of the Fractsidus, Schwarzloch. But I doubt that's your real name, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The children have toiled to script this grand spectacle and penned a part for me. How could I deny their goodwill?

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have slumbered in shadow for too long. This old vessel... yearns to stir.

Options.PlotLineKey: So the leader of the Fractsidus himself decides to show up...
You're not really him, are you?
You must've spent ages memorizing those lines.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are our honored guest. And so, you shall be received with all the reverence your presence commands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perceptive indeed. But this vessel, wrought from ancient tales, sufficeth to welcome you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time hath long since lost all meaning. I have dwelt in this world... for far, far too long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The path of return is barred by the Styx Lake. The <ano=Anchor Stone>Waystone</ano> was shattered by my own hand. Stay here, and I shall see you unharmed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You ferried us across only to bar the return. Well played.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The answer is plain to see.

Options.PlotLineKey: We must forge ahead.
There's no retreat.
We will be the Waystones.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one is going to stand in our way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A regrettable choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Violence is not mine to seek... yet the role I am given is clear: to halt the one who would end Leviathan here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave him to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go. Knock upon the gates of Paradise and let its bells toll through the dark to guide their way.

Options.PlotLineKey: Be careful.
And you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll find a way. Once it's done, I'll catch up. Remember our promise?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So long as one of us reaches Paradise, hope lives on. GO!

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well. Galbrena, let us see how far you have come since that day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Though Scar is driven back, his attack was only a diversion. High atop the Three Heroes' Crest, Phrolova's "symphony" is already in motion. A rain of Lycoris corrupts the Anti-Corrosion Wards, and the Dark Tide surges through the breach to swallow the lowlands of Septimont. Before they can drink the "antidote," your companions are swept into the Dark Tide...

Then, from the darkness, the ferryman Kharon returns and destroys the Anchor Stone you had just activated. In that moment, Galbrena realizes that his true identity is none other than Schwarzloch, the Grand Architect of the Fractsidus.

In this grand play, his role is to stop "the one who would end Leviathan." Kharon attacks, and Galbrena throws herself in front of you to shield you. She resolves to stay behind while you lead everyone to finish the mission—Knock upon the gates of Paradise and let its bells toll through the dark to guide their way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like it's just the two of us now, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can't give up. Not as long as there is hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right! I'll fight by your side till the end!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look! The path to the Paradise is just ahead! If we push through them, we're almost there! We'll make it!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide's influence is getting stronger... Are you alright, Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah... no worries!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Okay, I'll make it quick.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More enemies...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}... the "Journeying Paradise" is just ahead...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby's frequency is weakening... I can barely sense it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... Stop yapping... So dizzy...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Leviathan's whispers?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My head... it hurts. I can't take it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry, {PlayerName}... I...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Abby!

Chapters.Title: Perceive the Memory Shard left within the Dark Tide

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ENOUGH!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome, {PlayerName}. A pleasure to see you again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need to rush toward the abyss in such haste. Please, take your time to enjoy this interlude before the story meets its climax.

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't care about your theatrics.
What are you really after?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did Avidius's story stir sorrow and anger in your heart?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius's story stirred sorrow and anger in your heart, I presume?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By now, you must have realized that Rinascita's fate was forged by the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With that truth exposed, have you ever suspected that "humanity's fate" could also be the design of a higher being?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A girl born into a land ravaged by war... Tell me, why was she fated to stand against the divine and endure a "Second Suffering"? And that one, born of Sonoro itself, designed to serve as the "core of a hollow system"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who scripts such destinies? Who appoints such suffering? If fate cannot grant equal grace to all... If it cannot offer each soul a just and rightful end...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then perhaps it is we who must tear the old script and become the authors of a new one.

Options.PlotLineKey: You want to play god.
You want to rewrite humanity's fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter how noble your reason may sound, the crimes you've committed in Rinascita are far too great to ever be forgiven.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I care little for my own fate. I am but a small footnote in this "grand repertoire."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, my role will, too, end. And if that finale serves to bring the curtain down with perfection and grandeur, I'd gladly add it to the "script."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, my moment on stage has yet to come. The spotlight now belongs to the people of Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You wrote Avidius and all of Rinascita into a tragedy, just to prove a point.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You speak of divinities with disdain, but the moment you took up that "quill," you became no different. I don't trust you, or the "quill" in your hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Certainly. I do believe there is someone more worthy than I to wield it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've invited you before, many times. Should you choose to accept… you would be the one to hold that quill.

Options.PlotLineKey: Fate should be written by all of humanity.
No one has the right to dictate another's fate.
That quill belongs to no one. Not you. Not me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unbound by Rinascita's fate, and still, you descend into the abyss alone… to aid in their defiance of fate. Aren't you merely playing the role of savior?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know you bear a "power not of this world." It grants you a courage that borders on folly. But even so...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ovathrax's power lies dormant within Abby. A Threnodian's essence is one and the same. Should two such frequencies ever collide…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan could use the Dark Tide to possess Abby, merge with Ovathrax, and eventually, complete Its rebirth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I'm alright, {PlayerName}.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've never questioned what Abby is, have you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Never paused to wonder why it grows dizzy each time it absorbs the Dark Tide? You do already know what the Dark Tide really is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps, once Abby merges with Leviathan, it will recall what it once was and find its "true self." If that's the risk you're prepared to take, I suppose I can revise my script accordingly.

Options.PlotLineKey: So I was your target all along?
How long have you been setting this up?
Making me the Harbinger… was that part of your design too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan has long sought Its Harbinger, but you weren't Its first choice. That role was meant for Augusta, Septimont's current Ephor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Paradise should have descended as I had written. Yet the Priestess's arrow, fired at the cost of her very existence, sent the story veering off-script.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, any script worth its ink must be able to adapt. Just a few careful strokes, and we found the perfect protagonist to bear the mantle of despair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We knew your plan from the beginning. Now your companions are lost to the Dark Tide, adrift with no Anchor in sight, fated to sink endlessly into the depths.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for Cartethyia... The Divinity that granted her a second life is dead. Do you truly believe her Humanity alone can stand against Leviathan?

Options.PlotLineKey: I believe in all of them...
...Just as they believe in me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Hope amid hardship makes a finer tale than one of aimless doubt. The audience always favors stories steeped in distress, struggle, and ruin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alas, this interlude must end here. Leviathan stirs from Its slumber, and with Its wrath comes Its gospel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now then, show me... Show me that humanity can rise against the divine. Prove your will is your own. Prove you are worthy to pen your own fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if humanity cannot cross the threshold of the divine... then we shall be the ones to write its fate instead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tomorrow, and tomorrow, and tomorrow...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Creeps in this petty pace from day to day, to the last syllable of recorded time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All our yesterdays are but... faint glimmers lighting the road to the grave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Life is but a walking shadow, a poor player that struts and frets their hour upon the stage...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then, in the blink of a moment, is heard no more...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe in them... just as they believe in me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... of course. You've always been the protagonist of our play.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But what if, the one we speak of, "the one meant to end Leviathan"...is not you?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What...? So your true target is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The special scene between her and our Grand Architect must not be disturbed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For now, take a brief rest. The stage is nearly set for your finale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not long ago, by the Styx Lake...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So… I was your true target all along.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. Another stalemate awaiteth {Male=him;Female=her}. And you, the revenant returned from the Dark Tide... You are the one chosen to end Leviathan in our script.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know the power you wield. Left unchecked, it unravels the fabric of our play. And so, I must still your steps here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Yet I confess, Galbrena... Your growth hath far outstripped what I foresaw.
How many Tacet Discords have you devoured to stand here now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Heh. Do you count how many gemberries you've eaten in your life?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For one with a lifespan like yours, surely you know more than most. So go on. Take a guess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You risked all to save those who share no bond with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To choose to protect is one thing, but to do so wielding power not born of mankind... That, you should never have done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must have felt it. The cold stares of those you saved. No gratitude, only fear for that which they cannot understand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So what? I chose this path, and I'll follow it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your frequency now intertwines with the Tacet Discords. The moment you crossed that threshold, the mortal world... ceased to be your home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My offer still stands. Join the Fractsidus. You, too, have crossed the veil that parts life and death. Among us, you shall find haven and purpose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ever since I got these wings, I've found freedom in the open sky...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't need a haven or titles to cage me. I am what I choose to be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shoulds you crave power, we shall grant it, even that of the Threnodian. Should you seek to help, we shall guide mankind toward a future beyond all comprehension.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sounds like something a hypocrite would say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mortal sight is too narrow to fathom our path.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you think you stand above humanity, huh? Whatever, I don't give a damn about you or your grand ideals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I only need one reason to take you down. You're in my way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tacet Discords within you are gone. Now, tell me. What remains of you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've heard enough of this crap.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You hide behind borrowed faces. But me? I've never once doubted who I am.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've risen from blood and inferno a thousand times, faced the monsters that lined up to devour me, and fought back, without mercy...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I broke Harpyia's razor wings and tore out Balor's demon eye. Not even Dullahan's iron hooves could bring me to my knees. The Dark Tide cursed me long ago. I should have been dead, but here I stand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you think one of your clones can stop me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still clinging to hope? A sharp tongue may spark your courage, but it shall not change your end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then so be it. Forsake all hope of ever beholding Paradise. I shall guide you to the other shore, into eternal darkness... into hell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're already there, Schwarzloch.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
By the shores of Styx Lake, Galbrena faces Kharon alone, bloodied and spent. She realizes she has been the Fractsidus's true target all along.

Condescendingly, Kharon questions and tempts her: After devouring so many Tacet Discords, she has long since crossed the threshold of what it means to be human. The Fractsidus is where she can belong and find purpose.

Galbrena answers with scorn. She strikes again, but her bullets freeze in mid-air, her flames cannot reach him, and the Tacet Discords within her are torn away. Even so, she gets back up and charges in a final, desperate strike.

This time, Kharon does not hold back. A shadowed claw pierces straight through her chest. Galbrena only smiles faintly, as if this was her plan all along.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …This blood. It should be enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My flames could never reach you before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now… it's time you paid for your arrogance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The hunt begins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your flames… they purified the corrupted frequencies?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bullseye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May the flames light your way home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You just made a path swarming with enemies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which means it's the right one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... a path of slaughter, then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No needless bloodshed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tch… we will paint a trail in blood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan's presence is growing stronger. Flamewing won't last much longer in the air... Heh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Beholder's mark is set. With Shadow Fiend's power, I can throw the Feather Blade to move to the target location.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Prey marked. Time to end it in one shot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I'll use the Feather Blade to weave through 'em while shooting. That'll speed things up.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That stone... Looks like I can pull it loose.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I'll pull that stone loose. That'll clear a path.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah, the path is hidden. To another dimension then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hiding yourself, huh? To another dimension then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chimera! Tear the space apart!

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Almost there...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...{PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are too late. The purest Dark Tide has swallowed {Male=him;Female=her}, and the stairway to the Paradise lies in ruins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Run all you like, your chance to save {Male=him;Female=her} is already lost. Such is the nature of fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I believed in fate, I wouldn't have made it this far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You think that little flame can burn this Dark Tide? You drown in delusion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know it's not enough. What if... I add some of this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You intend to unleash the Tacet Discords within you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those savage frequencies alone will destroy you before the Dark Tide even gets a chance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tamed them once. I can do it again. It's just a matter of... what I'm willing to lose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If saving {Male=him;Female=her} means we still have a shot at taking down Leviathan…

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll risk it all. My will, my everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Lunatic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's see whose fire burns hotter. Don't tell me you're getting cold feet now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything you have fought to keep will burn to ash.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let it burn!

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time to make a choice again. Hunt with me, or die with me. If you still want to see Leviathan destroyed with your own eyes… this is your final chance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Either way, I've already made my choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …I called on you time and again to unleash your true power… And now, of all things, this is what gets through to you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You would risk everything for a sliver of hope?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I would. No matter the cost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
At the stairway to the Paradise, Galbrena arrives only to find you already engulfed by the Dark Tide. To save you, she unleashes the Tacet Discords within herself to burn the Dark Tide with hellfire. Yet against the purest of Dark Tides, even her flames fall short.

So she chooses to ignite her own "life force," setting herself ablaze, all for the sake of a single hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just as I foresaw, she arrives to save you from the abyss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A fleeting spark, kindled by all she once had… burning for a hopeless stand against the furious tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What awaits you is your end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, roving outlander, don that exquisite mantle once more...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And step onto the deserted stage you are destined to face.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How much time has passed...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No path to take... No way to go...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... what's that ahead...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before you, countless pale lights converge into an ancient stele, standing in austere silence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You reach out, fingers brushing the surface. A faint line of script emerges at its base.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Here lies Carlotta Montelli."

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After being engulfed by the Dark Tide, you awaken in an unknown space.

On a pallid shore stand countless gravestones, each bearing the name of a companion…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Death is a divine gift bestowed upon humanity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those you cherish now... a lucky few had their names carved into this ancient stone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But far more, those who once stood by your side, you've already let slip away. Like raindrops into the sea... lost to the depths.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, even this stele will follow. Swallowed by the tide of your fading memory. Just like the rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will not forget them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You've changed from who you once were. Still stubborn, as always... But now you fear losing what you have.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that... has made you weak.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go on, then. Your destination lies just ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the bustling stage quiets, all who played a part in your fate will take their leave. Only you remain for the final bow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From beginning to end, you've always walked alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That.. is the "truth" you cannot escape.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby's condition was written into our script long ago. Even if you strike Leviathan down, Abby can no longer serve as the vessel to seal Leviathan's essence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only one variable slipped past our design. Her, the revenant returned from the Dark Tide. She could have bridged your failing forces and brought Leviathan to Its end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the moment she gave up, your downfall was written. Hope, scattered like ash.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, Harbinger of the Dark Tide... you can save no one. What follows in your wake is ruin, and ruin alone.

Options.PlotLineKey: No... this is not the end...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm… Not fond of how the story ends, are we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, fortunately, you are not like the rest. Your fate rises above the masses. You... you still hold the power to choose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've always wanted to be the savior. Now, that chance lies before you. The one... you've known was coming all along.
Shut up, you noisy pest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't buy his nonsense, do you?

Options.PlotLineKey: Galbrena... Is that you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the flesh. Took a few tricks, but I made it in.

Options.PlotLineKey: What is this place?
That voice said this is the "truth" I cannot escape.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is your Mindscape. Leviathan drew it from the deepest layers of your mind using the purest frequency of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone has a Mindscape. Some say when countless seas of consciousness flow together, they make the essence of Solaris.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've seen many places, but nothing quite like this... It must mean a lot to you.

Options.PlotLineKey: ...I think so.
Is this... where it all began for me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I saw Carlotta, Brant, everyone... and you. You were all just like in that illusion I had before...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan preyed on your deepest fear of losing the ones you care about and turned it into these gravestones.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The ones who seem the strongest often fear loss the most. That's how Leviathan slips in, by exposing our pain to the light.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you let it take hold, you'll never break free. In the end, your mind and body will be devoured, dismantled, reshaped, and assimilated. It's no better than death.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, you could say this place hangs between life and death. Your friends are here too, each of them fighting their own demons. But...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you feel this?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes... it's warm. And real.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There. Look up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I hunt, I often travel through the night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The darkness is thick, but faint stars hang above to guide me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But those stars don't shine for me. Long before I even looked up, they'd already been watching over the sky.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan has underestimated human resolve. To me, these gravestones... they're signposts left by the "living" for those still fighting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like stars destined to burn out, they refuse to stop shining until the very end. There's always someone in the dark, giving their life to light the way and pass hope to those who follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why... you and I, we don't stop moving forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sometimes, all it takes... is the first step. That's enough to light the way for others. And maybe one day… they'll be the ones lighting the way for you.

Options.PlotLineKey: This story was never mine alone.
My fate is bound to others.
That's what this journey has always been about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know your past, but I do know the future you want isn't one of death.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Being scared of losing someone just means you're human. But the people you love, the ones who love you back... They'd never let you face the end alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This isn't where it ends. If you want a path to open... Remember all the people you helped Anchor to a future. Now, it's time to Anchor yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But before that... take a look behind you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've come a long way. Changed a lot of lives. That's your past, but it's also your strength. So use it. Hope... is still out there, waiting for you.

Options.PlotLineKey: This path lies right before me.
No more fear. No more doubt.
Just keep going, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take this spark with you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take the step... through darkness into the light.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Through the mist, a familiar vision takes shape. Cristoforo's whisper claims this is the truth you cannot escape. On destiny's stage, only you will remain for the final bow.

He claims your plan was doomed from the start. When the Discord Slayer fought to her last breath, your final hope turned to ash. As the Harbinger of the Dark Tide, you already know the only way to change the ending. A sword waits in front of you.

But Galbrena's voice pierces through the mist. She descends, alive and well, shattering Cristoforo's lies. She tells you to look to the sky, where the starlight dispels your doubt. What you must do now is take the next step.

She places a spark in your hand, a flame to carry you forward. Now walk. Through darkness, into the light.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, new allies born from the perils of the high seas! What better way to begin an epic story?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good people have their wishes fulfilled, heroes appear in a time of crisis, justice triumphs over evil, and united friends are undefeatable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Codex reminds us, "It is not the lighthouse that guides us through the storm to safety, but our own eyes fixed on the shore."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The difference, though, is that you are a blade. A weapon that can break the cycle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like I said, we seize control.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Music itself holds no emotion. It's the heart that grants it meaning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A person of true character should never be defined by an inanimate blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if one day you meet defeat, remember this. Those you've helped will never let you face it alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been thinking... our final fate might already be written, but how we walk that path is up to us. We, as humans, are meant to carve our own way forward!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A civilization's glory is forged by generations of brave souls. It was never meant to be one person's medal of honor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The waves of resistance shall never cease. Mankind will not be oppressed by the Threnodian...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... no, we will be right behind you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The power to write our fate has always been ours...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even without guidance, even when Divinity falls silent... Civilization will find its own way...

Chapters.Title: Walk along the path of light

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have no role in Rinascita's destiny!
You have no reason to carry on this fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We carry the Dark Tide's memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We command both light and shadow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you really think you could stand against us alone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Steel yourself...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Defy the prophecy. Rise above fate again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the road ahead is dark, then let this soul—

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: —Be the spark that lights the night.
Well said!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're not alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because we are here. With you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where the dark night ends lies the blazing sun. We all made it, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm back!
Is everything alright on your side?
Has anyone seen Galbrena?

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoes of Hope - Dragon of Dirge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Worry not, Herald of Hope. "We" have shielded them from the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Don't worry, it's just a scratch. Glad to see you're alright.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for that Grand Architect, heh... The spirits will guide him to the other shore.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you really alright...
But you don't look well...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She burned her own life force to help you. Only by Overclocking was she able to break through the Dark Tide's illusion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her true Forte has always been inside her. As her blazing will became Overclocked flames, that seared away the corruption of the Tacet Discords and the Dark Tide. It awakened her Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I took on some of the cost of her Overclocking... I admit her insolent gamble paid off again.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She saved me, but you saved her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe it wasn't really a gamble this time. I knew you wouldn't stand by and let me die.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Hmph. Then slay Leviathan and prove I was right about you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You awaken from the illusion. Your companions are by your side once more, and Galbrena returns atop the back of the Dragon of Dirge.

To reach you, she ignited her own life force, Overclocking her power to tear open the Dark Tide's illusion. Chimera bore part of the cost for her. Meanwhile, when Septimont and your companions were engulfed by the Dark Tide, the Echoes responded to humanity's hope and resolve. They came together in their strongest form to aid. Though the Anchor Stone was destroyed, your companions still followed a different beacon. You, the "Anchor of Hope."

Through the Dark Tide, all of your memories connected. They have learned of Galbrena and Cartethyia's plan too. But Abby can no longer bear the burden of the Gem. Galbrena offers to use her power of devouring to seal the Gem within herself. It is for this very reason that the Fractsidus made her their target.

Cristoforo believed his script to be flawless, but underestimated what small hopes, when united, can become. Now, before the gate of the Paradise, you and your companions stand together. It is time to break it open and cast down the false Divinity that waits beyond.

Options.PlotLineKey: I won't let you down.
I'm here because of all of you, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide showed us your memories… We know that Cartethyia planned her own "death" to plant humanity into Leviathan…

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her mind is asleep inside Leviathan's anchored body. If we can wake her, our chances of beating the Threnodian will grow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let Abby rest for now. When the Threnodian falls, use your power to "split" Its essence from the Gem. And I'll use my "devouring" ability to seal It inside me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …So that's the real reason the Fractsidus was targeting you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. But now, I've got backup. Neither they nor the Threnodian can stop us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cristoforo thought his script was flawless, but he missed one thing. Even the faintest spark of hope can ignite a blaze when we stand together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Defeating the Threnodian is what we all seek. That is what unites us here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan twisted our memories and emotions into this fake Paradise, hoping we'd surrender to Its will, and let It harvest our civilization…

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, the fate It's forced upon us is ours to shatter!

Options.PlotLineKey: Together, we'll bring Leviathan down.
Everyone, with me to battle!
No throne lasts forever. Even Divinity can fall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long as we hold on to our shared faith and hope, Leviathan will never win.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's time to break open the gate... and burn this false Paradise to the ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Finally recognize me, Augusta?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I almost didn't. You've changed a lot. But the warmth in that Resonance ability... That, I could never forget.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Glad to see we both stayed true to who we are. But we can catch up later. For now... How did you all make it here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just as we were about to take the potion and enter the Dark Tide, the Fractsidus triggered its surge. Leviathan pulled us into Its illusion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... the Echoes swallowed by the Dark Tide protected us. They bought us the time we needed to drink it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoes of Hope - Dragon of Dirge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan can mimic our form, but never our "soul."

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoes of Hope - Dragon of Dirge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We heard your call, strong and full of resolve. So we came, every one of us, to stand by your side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Echoes of Rinascita can sense human frequencies. When we reach out in hope, they answer us with hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But even with their help and the potion, we're still far from our goal... We fought through the illusions, but we still need an Anchor to open a path to the Journeying Paradise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have an idea! If Leviathan found Its <ano=Harbinger>Anchor of Reality</ano> to summon the Tidespawn into our world...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We follow suit and find an Anchor of Hope to find a way out of the world of the Dark Tide!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And who better for that… than you, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even in the depths of despair, you held on to hope... That unwavering faith makes you worthy of being our Anchor of Hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the <ano=bond>unbreakable tether</ano> we share is what led us to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …That's the Threnodian's Chrysalis, Leviathan's gestation pod. It's expanding the rift bleeding into our world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Temporal distortions! Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It thought dividing us would make us easy prey.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then It thought wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone, pay attention to those Cocoons summoning monsters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are linked to the Chrysalis above. Destroying them will weaken the Threnodian's hold.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Copy that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave them to us!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All Cocoons cleared on my side. How's it looking for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mission accomplished, Captain!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quickly and swiftly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That? Pfft, child's play. We handled it ages ago, obviously.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All Cocoons cleared on my side. How's it looking for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mission accomplished, Captain!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quickly and swiftly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That? Pfft, child's play. We handled it ages ago, obviously.

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoes of Hope - Lioness of Glory
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We will finish the remaining threats.

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoes of Hope - Dragon of Dirge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go and fulfill your mission. Defeat Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mortals must seek salvation... Mortals must follow a uniform creed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now... Righteous One... open the gate to ascension.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You are not her.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Reveal yourself, Leviathan!

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am the Beginning, and the End; the First Breath and the Final Sigh... I have ever been Rinascita's sole Divinity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By my Gospel alone didst thou arise, United and Reborn. And now thou dare lift thy hand against me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys… once more, the crown is thine. Return to my embrace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, faithless heretics... Kneel and receive thy judgment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
With the aid of Rinascita's Echoes, you reach the heart of the Paradise. The Dark Tide surges, surrounding you. Leviathan attempts to sway your resolve with Its whispers, but you see through the deception and fight on. At last, Leviathan reveals itself in the likeness of the Blessed Maiden, Fleurdelys.

The moment you have fought so long to reach has arrived. Now, brace for Leviathan's judgment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imperator's power is mine to command.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It's reaching for the Chrysalis to restore Its frequencies!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll handle it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, everyone...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It worked...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys... wilt thou cast aside thy godhood once more?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I stand here in the name of "humanity."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
