Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If my "humanity" alone can't sway you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we will defeat you together!

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thou dare pit mortal will against the divine?

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then behold...

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The deepest abyss of despair!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People of Rinascita, please hear my call...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unite... with all your will and hope!

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feeble resistance...

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The fate of Rinascita is mine to decree!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even the Threnodian's Chrysalis, turned into a weapon. So you're ready to take a final stand. Too bad... that won't bring us down!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan, may you now be bound...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the weight... of humanity's hopes!

Dialogues.Speaker: Threnodian: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abra... Abraxas! Why hast thou betrayed us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It's trying to absorb the Dark Tide!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll split the Gem from Its physical form.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time to finish this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our paths were never truly opposed... One day, they shall cross again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember this... We were once your "Waystones."

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Righteous One… Raise the lantern in your hand…

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Within it lies the will of every Primus of the Order, from Napoli the Second.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To my own resolve and atonement...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let its light banish this final darkness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rinascita will surely know... a lasting dawn.

Chapters.Title: Join the crowd, toward the kingdom rising in the dark waves...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This calamity… ends here. For good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Primus got what he wanted. He fulfilled the fate he desired for Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian's creatures have been defeated. They never broke through our defenses. With the Dark Tide now receding, it seems that all is resolved.

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I only played a small part. It was the courage of these warriors that truly held the line.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that you have returned safely, I'll continue with my mission.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scar from the Fractsidus... Did he escape again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, yes. I see you didn't catch the mastermind either.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Cristoforo got away… But don't worry, I will hunt him down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Fractsidus... The calamity has passed, but our city-states are weakened. We must rebuild. Recover. We cannot join this hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qiuyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Survivors deserve more attention than criminals who deserve to die.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rest assured, we're not forgetting this transgression.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Together with your companions, you defeat Leviathan. The Gem is devoured and sealed within Galbrena. With the will of Fenrico and all the past Primuses carried in the Lantern of Napoli the Second, you return safely from the Dark Tide, dispersing it once and for all. The Paradise collapses, the endless night fades, and at last, dawn breaks over Rinascita.

Atop the Three Heroes' Crest, Qiuyuan bids you farewell. While you ventured deep into the Dark Tide, he kept his promise and held the line with Septimont's Gladiators. Now, his journey must continue.

With her soul returned to her body, Cartethyia is revived. Through a voice in the sky, she promises to meet you again in Ragunna. You part ways with your companions from Septimont. Both city-states must now rebuild in their own way. But now, each day to come holds more hope than the last.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you... heroes of Rinascita...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that Cartethyia's voice?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey—Cartethyia! You're welcome!

Options.PlotLineKey: How do you feel, Cartethyia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I'm back to myself now. Let's meet in Ragunna City, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Defeating Leviathan was just the start of Rinascita's "new era." There is plenty of cleanup work ahead for everyone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Each day to come holds more hope than the last.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Septimont will have many matters demanding our attention. Ragunna will be no different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave Septimont to us. Ragunna's problems... Well, they're looking a lot more complicated than ours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once everything is settled, will you come home to Septimont City?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We will meet again, heroes.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phoebe?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahh?!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is everything alright? You looked like you were somewhere else just now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... I was just thinking how the Blessed Maiden's voice sounded just like the heavenly voice during the Carnevale...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I was wondering... about the Sentinel's messages we heard before... Was it... Do you think Their advice... "Consume healthy food, such as the Laurus Salad..."

Options.PlotLineKey: Yup, that was her.
That's... a long story...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imperator once said: "Let the winds of the past depart. The ships of this new era no longer need their guidance. No longer shall scroll and prophecy bind, but by humanity's will shall a new era be forged."

Options.PlotLineKey: We made it... Cartethyia...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've now truly returned from the "dead."

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-blessed Maiden!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, just call me Cartethyia. Rinascita's Divinity is no more, and with it, the "Blessed Maiden chosen by the Divine."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phoebe, your faith in the Sentinel has never wavered, nor has it been blind. It stems not from obedience, but from a deep belief in Their deeds and ideals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imperator once led the displaced to these isles, yet what allowed the Ragunnesi to stand firm upon the sea was not Divine favor, but their own efforts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The statue in the city was built in Their likeness, but it was the people who gave shape to the faith it stands for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Faith once united us. It was also what drove us to seek liberation… The path of civilization is never fixed. It shifts with what's being demanded at present.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And it's the people of a civilization who decide what they demand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...As it was in the beginning, and ever shall be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone has their tasks to do now... But in the future...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want you to have this, Pheobe.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imperator entrusted me with this relic. Within it is Rinascita's past, and... its future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rinascita's future...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh... but it's empty. Where is the recorded future?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The future... is already in your hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I see. Thank you, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From now on, perhaps I no longer need to hide who I really am.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... I'll join in rebuilding Ragunna too!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sign me up.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This calamity has passed, but now Ragunna must face a harsh truth. Primus Fenrico gave his life to stop the Dark Tide, and the Sentinel is gone.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (For the Ragunnesi, what fills their hearts now… is likely sorrow and uncertainty.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But at the same time...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Carlotta, we've finished tallying all our losses. Here's the full report for your review.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. Secure all salvageable relief supplies first. The remaining personnel should assist the Fisalias in treating the wounded.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rosemary has already dispersed the family's medicine in mist form. Thanks to that, treatment has been smoother than expected. The injured will be tended to shortly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Repairs on the Genesis Nexus are still underway, but some damaged Common Echoes are already operational again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave the residual Dark Tide frequencies to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, crew! Come lend a hand!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero's got a whole mountain of tools over here... Like this rapid adhesive gun!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're having trouble restoring the damaged buildings, Mr. Fulmine and I can help using our Fortes!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Imperator were here, They'd be happy to see this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You return to Ragunna City with your companions. In the aftermath of battle, the Ragunnesi have come to learn that Primus Fenrico gave his life to disperse the Dark Tide, and Sentinel Imperator is gone as well. Though grief and uncertainty are still fresh, many are already taking the first steps to rebuild their future.

Cartethyia arrives at your side, just as she promised. Together, you recall Imperator's words: The path of civilization is never fixed. It shifts with the needs of the present. And that's up to the people of a civilization to decide.

You turn to Phoebe, still caught in quiet confusion, and give her the Civilization Capsule, the Relic Imperator left behind. She quickly understands what you are entrusting to her.

Now, Cartethyia and Phoebe both step forward to help rebuild Ragunna. Naturally, how could you not be part of it too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Disaster recovery in Ragunna City is nearly complete. Thank you so much for your help, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're welcome. By the way, Phoebe, have you seen Galbrena?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss Galbrena? When she finished up here, I think I saw her heading to Margherita's Restaurant...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, I'll have one Forte-astic Fizz & Freeze gelato. Extra large. Thanks.

Options.PlotLineKey: ...Seriously, what kind of name is that?
Can't believe you actually said it out loud.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say if you mix mint, Viscum Berries, Mastic Nuvola, and cream in just the right proportion, you get a gelato that's not only packed with flavor, but sharp and cool enough to clear your head.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and the ad said if you say the name in one go, you get 30% off.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay... But how are you feeling with "that thing" in you? We've wrapped everything up here. Best we get to the Black Shores soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything's fine, Chimera's keeping it stable. Nothing to worry about for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though ever since I absorbed that essence, Chimera has been grumbling nonstop about craving something cold...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chimera
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well I said nothing.

Options.PlotLineKey: You're talking about yourself, right?
Chimera leaving you out to dry, eh？

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, I'm human too, you know. I'm allowed to want good food. Ugh... never mind, let's go.

Options.PlotLineKey: Wait.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby, time to dig in!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm—I've been dying for this!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss Margherita, one extra large Forte-astic Fizz & Freeze gelato, please. Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right away! You helped Rinascita through its darkest hour. Now it's my turn to make sure our heroes eat and drink like royalty!

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here you go! Double the scoop, on the house! Unlimited refills!

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't manage this on my own. Want to split it?

Options.PlotLineKey: Wow. Something even you can't handle?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "You don't have to carry it all yourself. Sometimes, it's okay to lean on someone else." Wasn't that your line?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, one side each?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Some time later, Ragunna City's reconstruction is nearly complete. You stop by Margherita's Restaurant to find Galbrena, ready to depart with her for the Black Shores to extract the Threnodian's Gem.

But she seems fascinated by the restaurant's new gelato special. Naturally, you don't want to spoil her good mood. Besides, it is about time you kept that promise—to treat Abby to a well-earned feast.

Still, even Galbrena seems a little daunted when Margherita brings out the extra-large serving. With a familiar smirk, she turns to you and makes an offer you have heard before: "So, one side each?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahhh, finally full... Hic... I think it's time for a nap.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One wish fulfilled... Alright, time to head to the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, their ship should have docked by now.

Options.PlotLineKey: That man...
Calcharo?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's the leader of the Ghost Hounds. Strong, ruthless, not someone to cross lightly. I teamed up with him once while hunting in the New Federation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He tried to recruit me, but I'm used to working alone, so I turned him down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They've got quite the network. I got that lamp Terminal through their channels.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He seems intimidating, but... I think he's alright. He did join the fight to protect Rinascita, after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you ever find yourself in the New Federation, you'll probably get to know him better.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After the meal, you and Galbrena head toward the harbor. You spot Calcharo, who aided Ragunna in the battle, waving from afar.

Galbrena mentions she once worked briefly with him back in the New Federation, and that, surprisingly, he's not all that hard to get along with. If you ever find yourself in the New Federation, you will probably have the chance to become better acquainted.

Chapters.Title: Head to the harbor in Ragunna City

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well now, {PlayerName}… looks like Rinascita's been tied up with a neat little bow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The other Bloombearers have already headed back to rest. They burned through every drop of strength out there. Once we've handed off the Threnodian's Gem to Tethys... I might even allow myself a few hours of real sleep!

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it weren't for the Black Shores, we'd have been completely ensnared by Leviathan's schemes. On behalf of the people of Rinascita, please accept our deepest gratitude.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is what the Black Shores does. We're just glad we earned our keep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This might be the first real conversation we've had since everything ended. Thank you very much, Galbrena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a shame I'm not able to absorb the Threnodian's Gem, not in my current state.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It would throw your power completely out of balance. Better to leave it with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And really, I couldn't have done all this alone. Everyone played their part.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, if you hadn't come to "kill" me, we never could've pulled it off.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Honestly, pulling off a fake assassination in front of two powerful Resonators, without flinching or getting caught... Yes, not exactly a walk in the park.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Luckily, with a clear target, there's always a way to make the shot land. I didn't need to take you on, just sell the scene. "Blessed Maiden, down in one." Easy enough.

Options.PlotLineKey: You're a real professional.
Promise me you two won't pull that kind of stunt again, okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? No praise for my performance? I was planning to use this whole affair as a play for next year's Carnevale...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, we had to make it convincing, didn't we? Looks like I've still got it. Hmm… perhaps it could be a play in the next Carnevale...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you like to join us, Galbrena?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel once said They didn't want the people to mourn Their passing with sorrow. What They truly wished to hear were songs and laughter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll be inviting our friends from Septimont, too. I do hope you'll all come, including you, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: Hooray! Carnevale!
I'm ready to wear that mask again.
I'll win the Laurel again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then it's settled! If you dare skip it, I'll drag you there myself!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
At Ragunna's harbor, a Black Shores vessel awaits. Cartethyia and the others arrive as well, offering thanks for the aid Galbrena and the Black Shores have given.

Soon, the time for departure comes. Your friends from Ragunna gather to send you off, and even your companions from Septimont arrive on Griffrexes to bid their farewells. Cetus the Tidebreaker rises from the sea to escort your ship. A wave of memories rises with you. Precious memories you will never forget.

To meet and to part, that is the rhythm of life. All that remains to say is: "Till we meet again."

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aha! See, Augusta? Told you we'd make it in time!

Options.PlotLineKey: Iuno… you…

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Septimont's mess is mostly sorted now. The Senate can deal with the rest. We don't do rushed goodbyes around here. No matter how far, we had to come send you off.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You, my fellow warrior, are someone worth chasing. Yes, we've been chasing victory all along, but with you, it feels like victory itself was itching to catch up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Next time we meet, you'll be even stronger, as will I. I'll be a Gladiator who can stand toe-to-toe with you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your strength comes from deep in your heart, unshakable and selfless. It shines above Septimont and reminds everyone what being a hero truly means.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fighting by your side has been an honor. By the eternal blazing sun, your name will be remembered in Septimont forever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This world will never forget what you've done for us, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And don't go forgetting us either, got it?! We're throwing a huge celebration in Septimont for this victory, and the Ragunnesi will be there too. So you'd better show up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cetus the Tidebreaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woooooo—

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's Cetus The Tidebreaker! Are you here to see our {PlayerName} off too? Haha, I remember the moment we met {Male=him;Female=her} like it was yesterday.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe it's more than just a farewell. I think the Tidebreaker wants to escort you on your journey.

Options.PlotLineKey: We'll meet again. I'm sure of it.
I'll never forget the memories we've shared.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So… till we meet again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Everyone
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Till we meet again, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But for now… it looks like it's time for goodbyes. At least for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order will soon elect a new Primus. From now on, Ragunna's affairs will no longer be decided by the Order alone. Instead, the Montelli and Fisalia families will help to guide decisions, together with the voice of the people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We will begin addressing the wrongs the Order has committed. Ragunna's future belongs in the hands of its people. It will be led by their shared will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our family will also continue expanding Rinascita's overseas trade routes. Perhaps one day, we'll cross paths again in a distant land.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And should you ever return to Rinascita, know this. You will always be our most honored guest and dearest friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not just us, but these little Echoes too. We'll hold this bond close, always.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you ever visit any fascinating places, promise you'll tell me all about it! I'll turn your adventures into verse and have them sung across Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, remember not to overdo it. Eat when you're supposed to, and don't forget... Life is meant to be enjoyed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To meet and to part... is a part of life. So please, accept this blessing I offer in my own name: May your eyes always shine bright with clarity, and may love and light guide you on every step of your journey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This wide, free world has always been your stage. Wherever you go, I believe you'll always shine as its brightest star.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's everything going?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good news and bad.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian's Gem has been successfully contained. Tethys is already running a full-power analysis as we speak.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However... the Gem we've recovered was incomplete.

Options.PlotLineKey: What the—... the Fractsidus again?
Could we have damaged it by accident…?
Could Chimera have eaten a part of it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're still investigating the cause. But look, successfully containing a Gem infused with the Threnodian's power? No small feat. It's already a huge step forward in our fight against the Threnodian and the Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Threnodian is truly bound to civilization, who's to say another one won't return to Rinascita in some new form…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, even if that happens, It won't be reclaiming this piece of Its power. That gives us a window to prepare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rinascita… the Land of Echoes... If Tacet Discords can be manually converted into Echoes and become tools to fight the Lament…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then maybe the Threnodian might also be something we could transform. Heck, maybe even utilize.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that's all theorizing best kept to caffeinated hours. For now, we'll need to wait until Tethys completes its analysis before drawing any conclusions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, I'm glad it helped. I'll be on my way then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, {PlayerName}… She's got real skill. Moves like she's already part of our rhythm. This kind of synergy doesn't come knocking twice. What do you say…?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone in the Black Shores has made it their mission to stand against the Lament. Our goals are the same, and we've been walking the same path from the start.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know you're not the type who likes being tied down by titles. But just remember this... You're not fighting it alone. So...

Options.PlotLineKey: Take your time to consider this offer.
Just think of this as a keepsake.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This flower marks you as one of us. Whether you join us or not, if you ever run into trouble out there, the Black Shores will have your back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see… I'll take it then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, one more thing. My last Terminal gave out after I… "used" it too much. Think the Black Shores could lend me a new one?

Options.PlotLineKey: You heard her, Aalto.
So, does that mean you're joining us?
If you want it, then you'll have to take it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Lend"? Please. You break it, you come get a new one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure thing! Now, I better head to the Greenhouse. Gotta reserve a plot for our new "Sprout."

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, come on, {PlayerName}! Just give the lady what she wants!

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks. Well then… till next time.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you forget that promise we made?
You still haven't told me your real name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Angel. That's my real name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Angel... Such a beautiful name... Hm? Hold on a sec! You're not planning to jump into the sea, are you? I could get you a boat—!

Options.PlotLineKey: That would be the least of her concerns.
That's how she is. Let her be.
Your boat is... well, not very durable.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry about her. Nothing's stopping that one. No storm, and no raging sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The extraction of the Threnodian's Gem is a success, though Aalto reveals that the recovered Gem is incomplete, and the Black Shores will continue investigating the cause. Still, to contain even one Gem infused with the Threnodian's power is already a huge step forward in the fight against the Threnodian and the Lament.

With the matter concluded, Galbrena prepares to leave. Aalto suggests that the Black Shores could always use more hands.

You invite Galbrena to join the Black Shores. Though you don't expect to tie down a free spirit like the Discord Slayer, she accepts your offer. She pins the Blake Bloom to her chest and fulfills her promise to tell you her true name: Angel.

She spreads her wings, and you let her go. You believe neither storm nor sea could stop her. One day, you will meet again.

As you watch Galbrena vanish into the skies, the paper crane that was once Avidius slips from you, rising gently into the high heavens...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yawn... You do love to make a person wait, don't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, breaking me out right under Mingting's nose without setting off a single alarm... Delicious. Tell me, how did you come up with that little idea?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's just say it was inspired by the Somnoire. Imagination, after all, remains humanity's sharpest blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the Dark Tide spread and I was pulled in deeper, the mark of the Dark Tide you left in me allowed my frequency to merge with it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. And through Leviathan's power, I was able to "read" that frequency and "depict" you back into reality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan's power of assimilation blurs the line between imagination and existence, turning fiction into fact.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But of course, none of it would have worked until Leviathan slipped the Sentinel's leash and reclaimed the reins of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It cost more time than I'd have liked, but everything unfolded exactly as you scripted. Such precision. Such devotion... Bravo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A trial, nothing less.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Civilization's infancy must come to an end. So long as humanity remains cradled in the Sentinel's arms, it will never walk, let alone evolve. That is why I wrote this final act.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And those who cannot transcend their limits and overcome their lesser natures, who remain imprisoned by their own making... Well, such souls deserve no salvation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No souls deserve salvation. Why even try? This world was born from Chaos and exists in disorder. The only winning move... is to be worse. Wilder. To out-chaos the Chaos.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every noble act of salvation only makes Chaos hungrier. You want to destroy to save, but me... Ha, I want to save to destroy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You sound disappointed in how this story ends.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did I say that? Your stories have always been a treat. Screaming crowds drowning in despair, a world tearing at the seams... Every collapse, every unraveling... Chefs kiss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If they cannot overcome the pain, then let them fall straight into the ending I want: an eternity of chaos and suffering. That's why I chose to work with you, dear playwright.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, Quillbearer who toys with hearts, your sins weigh as heavy as mine. Tell me... where will your ending play out?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It has already been written into the script.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But until I reach it, as long as breath remains in me, I will haunt the stage like a phantom. A reminder... that one must always look forward, sharpen thy self, and temper thy soul.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, {PlayerName} wasn't wrong about you. You really are a cruel, extreme man. Sometimes I think you might be even more insane than I am.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Insanity, reason… or something in between... All are choices born of free will. And only through free will can we defy the surging tides of fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is why we both seek to change it. For beneath such tides... no one is content to remain merely a humble servant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You lost the Gem I entrusted to you, Cristoforo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgive me. But haven't we already seized what we truly desired?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see, even <ano=Journeying Paradise>the Beyond forged from Leviathan's power</ano> couldn't endure. It fell short of the perfection you long for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if you wish to try again, I remain at your service.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell me, how much of <ano=Leviathan>It</ano> remains within you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not much, but enough to make use of.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I've fulfilled my promise to complete your finale. Let this be the last note of our symphony.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you wish. My sincerest gratitude for your wonderful performance, Lady Phrolova. May you find the strength to create the Beyond you once envisioned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If this world truly cannot change, perhaps I will seek a new path for myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh… who'd've thought someone as stubborn as she would learn to adapt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But, Grand Architect, are you really going to let her walk off and do as she pleases?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of all of us, you are the last one with any right to judge her for following her whims.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Judge? You wound me. I'm far more faithful to my indulgences than she ever was. No, no, no, no, I just want to tag along… and add a few more flourishes to her symphony.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are still greater matters that demand your attention. Though our roads diverge, our ideals remain as one. In the end, they all lead to the same place. Separation is but the prelude to possibility.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All so that humanity may cross... that final gateway into eternity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our goals in Jinzhou and Rinascita have been fulfilled. A Threnodian's Resonator, an artificial Threnodian, and a Second Resonance Awakening. We now possess both the knowledge and the means.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kharon (Schwarzloch)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Next... it is time we turn our gaze to our accomplishments in Lahai-Roi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Somewhere in Rinascita, the members of the Fractsidus gather once more…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine work, {PlayerName}! With Rinascita safe for now, we've earned a proper breather.

Options.PlotLineKey: There's still something I'd like to know.
You've worked hard too. Get some rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If there's anything you want to know, ask away!

Options.PlotLineKey: About the Journeying Paradise…
About the Threnodian's Gem…
About Abby…
That's all. Get some rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, the Paradise. A realm created by Threnodian Leviathan and the destination of the Dark Tide...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But judging by its nature, its reach, and the havoc it could bring… its "descent" is nothing less than what we define as the Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, without question, your actions, {PlayerName}, kept that from becoming a true Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rinascita… what a journey it's been. Truly one for the epics...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean the missing frequency, right? We've already cross-checked it against Chimera and Cartethyia's frequency samples left here at the Black Shores…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not a single one aligned. Not even close.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which means… we can't dismiss the chance that the missing frequency has already been seized by the Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But don't worry. We've sped up the Gem's analysis. Even if the Fractsidus is scheming, we'll have countermeasures ready.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby? It's a curious case. Even in the deepest databanks of the Black Shores, we found no relevant data...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But in that battle against the Journeying Paradise… Leviathan spoke Abby's name.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Yet no one else seemed to react. Was it only Abby and I who heard it?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Abby's true identity… Perhaps I'll only uncover it on the road ahead.)
